review.reviewText: Beds were hard as a rock, walls were thin, hallways looked like a service station filled with maid carts, definitely not worth the $250 price tag. But the staff were informative, friendly and efficient. And the Airport Shuttle came right on time!

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: The room was simple and nice.  It was the best option financially within close proximity to the airport.  There's a cute sitting area/courtyard in the center of the hotel. Check in/out were extremely easy.  Some of my outlets did not work, but I find that happens in a lot of hotel rooms.  It was very comfortable and quiet.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: It's in the middle of an industrial type area...not much within walking distance and the walking is along a busy highway. You'll have to have other transportation plans. The hotel is clean and realitivly safe. It's an average economy hotel. The staff, however, was super nice and helpful!

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Older hotel that shows its age, located right off US 101 surrounded by industrial area, very noisy. Rooms out dated with the exception of the flat screen TV.

Absolutely terrible , only room for the beds, bathroom very small, sink out in room. Only one elevator and broke when we were departing and we were on third floor with all our luggage we had to carry all our selfs down to lobby.
There were lots of complaints and the continual breakfast was a joke, I want to thank Expedia for that one.

Joe

review.title: Reasonable Hotel near SFO
review.reviewText:
Clean hotel, good shuttle service, nice staff - very helpful. Comfortable rooms, especially for an overnight waiting for a flight. Decent CONTINENTAL breakfast, nice and early so you can get a flight. Don't expect eggs - see the caps in the previous sentence.

Good shower - yay!

review.title: Got there at 11pm, found NO PARKING!
review.reviewText:
We arrived late, yes I understand. However I expected to at least arrive park, check in and head to bed. They suggested we park behind the building. Which was dark and seemed unsafe. My husband made his own parking spot as did others who probably has the same problem. In the morning after we got some rest my daughter wanted to watch TV as we got ready to head back to the pier. The TV didn't work! Had to have the maintenance man come fix it. Mind you I am trying to get ready and this interrupts my routine makes us late. He was quite nice though. The room over all was nicer than I expected. We literally just slept there so we weren't looking to pay an arm and a leg so I was worried about how clean it was going to be. I have heard the saying, you get what you pay for and this had me a little nervous since we didn't pay so much considering what others were charging. 

If you are looking for a reasonable place to rest your head. This is actually a decent place. It was clean and comfortable enough for the price. It's about 30 minutes from the pier so it wasn't too far off, yet far enough that you don't pay so much for a place to sleep while in San Francisco.

review.title: One man's nightmare!
review.reviewText: My friends and I had arranged our trip to San Fransisco several weeks in advance. It was my job to arrange for the hotel and car. I have used Expedia on several occasions to book or reserve the things needed for my trips. I'm satisfied with Expedia but not with this Hotel at all. Although we were greeted in  a professional manner we soon learned of the problems with our rooms. The trim paneling for the door was missing on one side, a light bulb was burnt out and the room was dusty as soon by a large amount of dust which had accumulated around the vents. My friend who is elderly and disabled found very quickly that the main door lock to his room was malfunctioning. Upon calling the front desk they came up and had to toggle both the inner and outer handles to get the door to close. They didn't fix the problem only blamed it on a malfunction and showed my friend how to proceed from there on out. At 3:33 am the fire alarm went off due to a broken hot water line. We got no sleep so it didn't make for a very good day! Lastly we had a cookie ice cream which was taken by the front desk and put into there refrigerator for us to pick up but when we returned the next day it was gone!
review.positiveRemarks: Without getting any sleep it is extremely hard to say what we did like but I will say the staff tried to speak to us in a professional manner.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of the rooms as well as making sure that everything is working correctly before renting them out to guests.
review.locationRemarks: The location was close to the airport but we found that for our needs we needed to travel at least 20-30 minutes away to get to anything of interest.

Small, probably 70+ years old, only 4-5 people could get in and you never knew which floor it would go to no matter which button you pushed. Beds are small and you can feel and her all the springs. Pillows were thin and lumpy. The continental breakfast had much to be desired. Sat only 12 people at a time. Coffee was BAD, the instant hot cereal must have been old or something as it came out of the package in two separate lumps. One type of bread was only available. Absolutely no form of protein was present. The only fruit was apples and they had seen much better days. Front end staff were our only exposure and they were pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Good location, subpar facilities
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is great - super close to the airport so it's nice for a good touch down location for the night. The hotel offers shuttles which also makes it really convenient. However, the facilities are below average and the room wasn't quite what I expected either. The hotel seemed run down and I avoided using the bathroom in the room during my entire stay. We got in close to midnight and left around 10 am so we didn't stay for long and that's what I recommend you to do too. The breakfast was a nice touch and got my morning started off right and I never felt unsafe. I think the room should actually be a little cheaper than what it was considering the condition of the hotel but for my needs, it did the job.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttles to and from the airport, breakfast in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower price, better condition of hotel and room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. There's a Denny's within walking distance.

review.title: Hotel fairly close to the airport
review.reviewText: First off the shuttle from the airport only runs until midnight, and our plane landed at 11:30 pm so we were able to run to catch the last one. They share a shuttle bus with multiple hotels, so they are very full. When we were waiting to be checked in we heard the front girl quote someone n the phone a much lower rate than what we prepaid with a discount online travel provider. The room was small, the bed was old, the tv was so small we needed a telescope to watch it from the bed. There was pubic hair all over the shower walls. The towel rack was just barely hanging on the walls, and was just generally what you would fine in a motel room that rents by the hour. There was no soap, just shampoo. The room had very busy and noisy hallways, but that could have been because the type of clientele this property attracts. The breakfast was substandard, the room they have it is way too small and many didn't have room to sit and eat. They put out cereal but had no bowls. The orange juice just dispensed coloured water. The bagels were fresh, and the apples were good. If you have a choice on accommodations, I would advise a pass on this one
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing less than tear it down and rebuild a nice property in this great location
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO airport

review.title: A very nice hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText:
I found this small quaint hotel online when I was looking for a reasonably priced place to stay.  It's close enough to the highway and the airport to allow quick access to both without being bothered by the highway or airplane noise.  Being on the outside of "the city" were devoid of all the traffic, but it was close enough to get in and out of the urban life.  The eateries in the area isn't much to brag about, but again we were close enough to the highway to head north or south to some really nice places.  In particular, we found Burlingame very delightful.  Nice little downtown with interesting shops and restaurants with very good prices.  

The hotel itself was quiet and very clean.  The elevator is very interesting, but it worked well.  The Wi-Fi was also good and the parking was convenient.  Overall we enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Again, the best thing about this hotel is it's distance from the airport and the city.  Easy in and easy out.
review.negativeRemarks: More towels up front would be idea.  We had to ask for extra towels, but they got them to us in no time.
review.locationRemarks: We spent a great deal of time running into the city and this location was idea for that.  The highway is so close were thankful.

review.title: Great price for the location.
review.reviewText: We were happy with the price and convenience of having a free shuttle to the airport.  Quick, close, convenient to the airport for our late flight coming in and to catch an early flight out.  Free shuttle to airport international platform was just a very short walk to the BART, which we took down town daily.   Also just a short walk to IHOP and a couple restaurants as well as the bus line which also takes you right downtown, just a little longer than the BART.  For my first trip to S.F., these were helpful, yet you may want to study the connecting cable car, bus, and other routes prior to riding the bus to the Embarcadero to save time if you are going to Chinatown, or up over to the Golden Gate Park.  Felt more safe riding the BART and Bus downtown than I did riding the over crowded trolleys on the waterfront where my wife's wallet got jacked when the trolley became overcrowded in a surge.  Elevator in hotel was a little difficult to navigate at first since it was behind a door in the hallway.  Breakfast was plentiful for a continental style. Cereal, bagels, coffee, juice etc.  If you expect a big breakfast, go to IHOP.  Courtyard in back was relaxing.  Great Hotel for the price for travelers who know where they are going and just need a convenient crash pad while doing day tripping in San Francisco.  If you're doing the nightlife, you may need to take a cab because it's out by the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Overcrowding in breakfast room makes it very challenging to get in to use microwave, toaster, etc. with wall partition.
review.locationRemarks: Grab the shuttle to the airport, then catch the BART to downtown in 30 minutes.  Or ride the bus and see the local's view of the city coming into town

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
Standard motel, located conveniently close to the airport, with an airport shuttle cycling by every half hour. Several restaurants and gas stations are within a few blocks walking distance. Offered a complimentary breakfast of the standard self-serve variety.

There are a McDonalds, IHOP, and Denny's all a few blocks away, which can be walked to without issues. You can also walk to the San Bruno BART station, if you're up for a 1.5 mile stroll through an industrial park area (which might not be comfortable for some after dark). Alternately, you can take the airport shuttle, and use the BART station at the airport.

review.title: Great place to stay at a great price.
review.reviewText:
Staff was friendly, and courteous.  We enjoyed our stay!  Plus the price was great!  

Hotel offers continental breakfast, which was not the best.  They put out a few bagels, some cereal, juice and coffee.  The room where they offer the continental breakfast is also small and on the days we were there the hotel was packed.  My husband and I ended up getting coffee and my daughter just ate a bagel.  It was just too crowded in that small room.  

I knew about the parking charge before we arrived to the hotel thanks to the reviews.  It was not a surprise, however they really should consider offering free parking for their customers.  

Besides the breakfast, and the parking the hotel was great.  If we are ever in San Francisco we would definitely consider staying here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was clean, and staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Continental breakfast, and free parking.
review.locationRemarks: This is an "airport hotel".  I wouldn't say its conveniently located, but if you take a car everything is about a 30 minute drive away.

review.title: Barely adequate
review.reviewText:
Prices are high around SFO, even the rates at Holiday Inn Express were high. We chose Focus because we were only staying one night to catch a very early flight out of SFO. That allowed us to return the rental car early and all we needed was a room.

The room was incredibly small and while our AC worked, the AC in our friends room did not. The elevator was a disaster. It's old school which means you have to open a swinging door to access the regular, sliding doors and it was not wide enough to accommodate a full luggage cart.

The room, as I said was tiny. There is no fridge and the bathroom sink is outside of the bathroom and in the entrance "hall". There is no vanity, just a sink.

There is only one set of vending/ice machines and they are on the first floor. Very few outlets in the room and none by the bed at all that could be used. No restaurant or bar and not many food options within walking distance, except for a Houlihan's Bar at another hotel--about a 5 minute walk.

If I were a single guy looking for a place to flop into bed to catch an early flight out, I'd say the price per night stay is OK. Otherwise, if more than one person or kids, I'd go elsewhere. Ditto if you want to eat or drink on premises.

The shuttle service was excellent and that was a plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator, more vending , better bathroom/sink facilities, fridge.

A slight pause went by as I thought they were just joking in unbelief, then I snapped. Told them to comp my stay if they couldn't fix it or switch me rooms. They then told me that all the rooms were booked and there was nothing they could do, sorry. (But not sorry) the room was extremely hot. Uncomfortable and I slept terribly. Left early the next day and the woman at the front asked how my stay was, I told her and still had to pay for my stay. All she said was. Oh I'm so sorry to hear that.... What!?  Never go here. It's terrible customer service, no air, no remote to the small tiny tv. Rust in the shower and power and toilet paper dispenser on the wall looked like termites had eaten away at the wall making it an unappealing look and dirty.

review.title: Most painful sleep of my life
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was midrange, more of a Motel 6 feeling.  This did not really bother me, since I knew that I was paying to stay at a 4 or 5 star hotel.  What got me was the bed, I have NEVER in all the times I have stayed in a hotel slept in a bed that was so painful.  I did not sleep, woke up about every hour because my whole body hurt.  I don't know what it was about the mattress, but it was broken down, lumpy, and I could feel springs jabbing me in the ribs and back.  As a hotel that ranged at 2.8 stars I expected a little more for my money.  I basically paid $100 or so a night just to have a roof over my head.  Now that I am home, I am having to invest money in working out the pain in my back. I am not one to complain or every write reviews but, I have never felt this way after returning home from a trip.

review.locationRemarks: You get a nice waterfront view on the south side of the hotel, maybe get to see a dead fish float past

review.title: Stay away, don't be fooled by pictures
review.reviewText: The hotel is in industrial area, right under a high voltage electric pole. The beds are cranking, shower head leaking all night, power outlet so old, it breaks when I plug in my cell phone charger. The surrounding is dirty, completely regret that I got fooled by the pictures. And the staffs are rude.

review.title: vacation
review.reviewText: We reserved the room with Expedia and we asked them we will check in at 930 am , they left the note for the hotel crew that we will arive at this time . When we get there they did not even read the Memo , but they let us check in hour after that . That's the only issue we had other than that every thing is good , it's clean, good breakfast, wifi .

review.title: Dirty Hotel and in a congested area.
review.reviewText: I do not stay in such hotels that was as dirty as this hotel. Yes it was cheap , but the stench and dirt was not ok .
review.negativeRemarks: Clean it and do away with the smell.
review.locationRemarks: It was in a hard to get and congested area.

review.title: Convenient to airport, good value.
review.reviewText: Was great to have hotel so close by when arriving at SFO late at night. Area was a bit on the industrial side, but room was in good shape, breakfast was 'not bad at all.'
review.negativeRemarks: Facility could be prettied-up, but was OK for the price.
review.locationRemarks: Location not so pretty, but did not feel unsafe.

review.title: Rooms need maintenance
review.reviewText: The hotel in close to the airport and main freeways. Common facilities are in good conditions and clean. However, at least our room needed an urgent maintenance and general renovation. In my opinion you don't get what you are paying for.

review.title: Great hotel for a night
review.reviewText: We stayed a night to freshen up before boarding a flight. The room was clean, there was only one person working and he was friendly. It's close to some late night dinners, so if you are hungry you can get some food. Didn't like the $7 parking fee, but, I guess other hotels are doing the same thing.

Since its only about $80 per night, this motel is a really nice one at this price. But there was one staff, he's only nice to yound beautiful ladies and shows cold face to men. This is really a good motel but I just dont like that guy.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText:
Check-in was speedy and efficient but that is the best I can say for this hotel.
The noise transmitted from both inside and outside made it impossible to sleep, there were no towels in the room and although it is listed as an airport hotel with free breakfast, nothing is available before 6am so if you have an early flight you will need to make other eating arrangements.

review.title: Run down  - work needed
review.reviewText: when I first got there the desk staff appeared stressed because it was busy. She was very quick at check in but wasn't real friendly. They charge an additional charge for parking (which I normally wouldn't mind paying), when I went to towards my room there was what appeared to be a HUGE water leak and cones up on around a spot on the carpet (about 15 ft long) that SMELLED horrible. Of course my room was right near it. The room smelled just as bad, I had to open the window for the night. The room was not clean at all, the walls were dirty and had hair on them, dirt on the bathroom floor and a huge bubble on the ceiling that looked like it was full of water (unsure where it was coming from). the bed was like a kids mattress that was very thin and hard. I would never stay near this place again. The ice machine had broken parts and it looked dirty and disgusting.
review.negativeRemarks: remodel and clean... have the carpet cleaned so it doesn't stink

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel is reasonably expensive, and I expected better. Two good things, close to the airport, and a good every 30 minute shuttle service from airport. Bad things..shabby, run down. The hallways are seriously depressing. The walls are so thin, and the doors to rooms don't reach the ground,so you can hear everyone in the hallways. The room itself, shabby, old fashioned, and the bathroom very very tired. The bed was ok, nice sheets. Breakfast promised( on expedia, waffles and muffins). None of these, just toast, cereal and coffee.  Not good enough Hotel Focus.

Stayed for one night because we were getting to SF late and didnt want to pay too much or deal with traveling into the city that late. We headed into the city the next morning. It was perfect for what we needed it for.

review.title: Worth it!
review.reviewText: Very nice experience. Very clean. Very quiet - quality double pane windows, so you can't even tell you're right by the highway. Service was nice. Walls are a bit thin, and you can hear everything going on in the hallway, but that's pretty usual for any hotel. Beds were comfortable. Overall, very good experience and so affordable!

review.title: Not what I Expected
review.reviewText: Parking is not included in your rate. the hotel was poorly remodeled.  Ran out of hot water.  TV was very poor reception.  Elevator was a joke.
review.negativeRemarks: everything, the hotel was poorly remodeled.  Ran out of hot water.  TV was very poor reception.  Elevator was a joke.

review.reviewText: First time is the last time. Never again. Worst hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
The good is the free shuttle service from and to the airport every 30 minutes. Once in the bus, you will be in five minutes in your room.
The bad is that the hotel is too far from downtown. 1 hrs away using the bus or metro
The good is the breakfast included refilling all the time with fresh fruit and bagels
The staff are friendly and the internet is fast
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are quiet and beds confortables
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator is too old with no displays
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes in the shuttle to the airport and metro station

review.title: Horrible Hotel!
review.reviewText: The room had an awful smell that wouldn't go away even with Fabreeze!!!! The sheets were disgusting! When we told them that we demanded clean linen they brought sheets in for US to change ourselves! We were charged for parking but had to park on the street because there were no parks on the lot! (Of course I got a refund but not until the manager walked out to see if my car was really parked on the street). The manager was rude with absolutely NO customer service skills!!! This place should more appropriately be called a motel!!! It was extremely uncomfortable! We would've felt better sleeping in the car!!!!

review.title: Inexpensive, Dark & Dirty near SFO
review.reviewText: Booked because of the affordable price and proximity to airport. Got the job done in that regard.  Pictures online make the rooms appear bright, up to date, and inviting, but reality tells a different story. You get what you pay for!
Lamp chord was spliced with a new plug and sealed with electrical tape only. Yikes!!! Not fire safe. Shuttle bus did not run on time.

review.title: Good, cheap airport hotel
review.reviewText: The staff didn't really seem to care we were there. We had to ask about the shuttle bad felt we were being annoying when we inquired when this was one of the selling points on their website. The place itself was very clean, there was a cute outdoor sitting area, and the shuttle was timely.

review.title: Clean hotel next to the bus stop & caltrain
review.reviewText: It was clean & comfortabke, the breakfast room was very small we were waiting in the line mostly

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: The beds are hard as a rock. The bathroom shower had a big hole in the sheetrock where they installed a circular shower rod and didn't repair the big hole in the sheetrock. The carpet was unraveling where it meets the new tile when you walk in. This should have been $69.00 a night room. Pay another $40 per night and stay somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Not much. It was close to the airport, that is about it.
review.negativeRemarks: A complete interior upgrade of everything in the room.

review.title: Rooms are too small and not very clean
review.reviewText: A hotel for one night stay only. Breakfast room is too conjusted guests dont get a space to sit and eat. WIFI worked only downstairs not in the rooms.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Stayed there twice in a month both times hot water was broke! The maids are lazy two days in a row didn't clean my room! Just horrible

review.title: Awful location
review.reviewText: I was lied to and told this location was in walking distance to the Bart.  Every time u want to go into the city u have to take an airport shortl to get to Bart

review.title: close to SFO
review.reviewText:
It is close to the airport, but one doesn't hear the noise from it. Rate, free shuttle, free breakfast are all OK. Clean room with hair dryer, coffee maker for two cups,  iron, TV, air conditioner, free WiFi. 
Cards and maps for museums and recreation areas.

review.title: Room very small
review.reviewText: Room was clean but very small. Went to free breakfast, just toast, cereal, fruit. Orange juice was spoiled. Would not stay here again.

review.title: Terrible Bed
review.reviewText: I knew i was going to a cheap hotel, but it was not even worth the price.  The bed was a rock and the rooms were from the 70's.

review.title: Very adequate hotel, close to San Francisco Airpor
review.reviewText: I was VERY disappointed about the ringer on my room phone not working.  I had requested a wake up call in order to make a flight.  When I spoke with the desk about the ringer not working on the phone and my concern about my wake up call, I was assured that it was "okay now and you will get your wake up call."  Not being able to trust that since I could not afford to miss my flight, I stayed awake all night.  No wake up call came.  It is fortunate that I did not trust the staff regarding the condition of my phone.  It would have been very upsetting to have relied on them and slept through my flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure the phones in the rooms are functional.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.  I was only staying for a flight layover and did not get into doing anything nearby.

review.reviewText:
The construction of this hotel is pretty flimsy. Regardless of its proximity to the highway, it was the noise that travelled between the walls and floors that proved the most disruptive and kept us up.
A neighboring hotel, equally close to the highway and less expensive, provided better sound proofing and more modern/updated furniture and amenities (ie, an office center with working computer and printer).
review.positiveRemarks: The continental breakfast is generous and the seating area is pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the sound proofing -- even just hotel room to hotel room.
review.locationRemarks: We needed to be close to the airport, so we were satisfied with the location.

review.reviewText: I stayed here for a night and it was [pleasant.  The breakfast was minimal - bagel, bread, cereal, and coffee, but it was enough I guess.  The best rate for parking your car when you are flying out of SFO and flying in.  I will use this hotel again if i need to stay overnight or to park my car.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast!
review.locationRemarks: SFO Airport

review.title: Clean but is more like motel than hotel.
review.reviewText: Disappointing, we get charge for parking. We didn't get a tour or directions where to find the elevator, was mention breakfast from 6 to 9 am but no directions for the restaurant, the bathroom is too small. The closet has no door.

review.title: Worst hotel I have EVER stayed in my life!
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel online for our weekend family vacation ignoring the mixed reviews.

1. Upon arriving at 11pm I sent my wife in to begin the check in process due to my 5 year old sleeping in the car. She immediately called me and told me the staff wouldn't even talk to her about the booking without me present even though she explained to them the situation. I do understand this as a privacy concern so I let it go.

2. After parking and taking our luggage and sleeping child to check in we were told at the front office there was an additional $7 fee to park in the normal parking area. Although no signs were posted and there was zero warning of this outside. I was given a small yellow piece of paper and told I HAD to put that in my car window immediately or my car would be towed if not. So I had to leave my wife, sleeping child, and luggage in the lobby and run all the way to the other end of the parking lot in the 40 cold to put this piece of paper in my car.

3. Upon opening the door to my 3rd floor room we noticed the entire room was freezing. This was due to the window being WIDE open. There wasn't even a screen on the window!  We had to close it and shoe away a few flies.

4. There was literally a 1.5" gap between the bottom of the door leading to the hallway. You could hear EVERYTHiNG outside the room.

5. The bed was the word bed I have ever slept in my entire life. It felt like the springs were popping thru the mattress. There was zero padding.

STAY AWAY

review.title: What a nightmare
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel since it is so close to the airport, biggest mistake of the entire trip. Check in took about half an hour because the front desk attendant did't know what he was doing, struggling with simple things as making a copy of an ID. All of the halls smelled like urine, the staircases were even worse. The elevator barely works. There is nothing nice to say about this place. Stay away from there !!!
review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs to be properly trained

review.title: Don't believe the pictures
review.reviewText: It appears that a renovation was attempted but was poorly done. The window in our room had a gap between the windowpanes allowing air to come in. The room was not very clean and housekeeping did did a poor job cleaning the bathroom, vacuuming the floors and changing the bedding. We had to ask for towels ever day and the bath towels looked like someone had cleaned his shoes with them. Also the breakfast was sparse and not very sanitary. Finally because the windows didn't close completely you could hear every plane that took off from the airport nearby.  POORLY MAINTAINED spend your money else where!

review.title: Cost effective near the Airport
review.reviewText: Easy access, easy to find, lots of parking, good friendly staff, clean comfortable room for affordable price
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access, easy to find, lots of parking, good friendly staff, clean comfortable room for affordable price
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Easy access, easy to find, lots of parking, near the airport

review.title: Not as advertised
review.reviewText: We took two rooms for 2 nights at this hotel which proclaimed itself as being recently refurbished. More correctly it should be advertised as recently disguised. Throwing a coat of paint on worn and damaged walls does not equal refurbishment. It is not as it appears. On the first night one of the rooms was dark because of a blown circuit breaker, the 20 inch "flat screen TV" was missing its remote and there was no coffee for the coffee maker. The second night one of the rooms was missing all bath linens. The towels that were provided were dirty and had hair. Both rooms, as well as the hotel in general, are not well maintained; dirty walls and carpet, mismatched and worn furniture, and the bathrooms were very dirty, . One room was missing a night stand. The breakfast consisted of dry cereal, juice machine, instant coffee machine, and bagels and some fruit. No warm food such as the advertised "waffles". To make matters worse, the hotel is noisy with an unusual amount of coming and going at all hours of the night. The only bright side was the bed and bed linens were comfortable. Spend a few dollars more and stay at one of the many other choices in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything. Ad should be more realistic and honest.
review.locationRemarks: Located near noisy road in a mostly commercial/industrial area. A IHOP and Denny's are close by but we were disappointed with their food.

review.title: nice hotel staff
review.reviewText: weekend getaway. it is a basic hotel, but the staff is really polite and hard working.  the facilities are kept clean .
review.positiveRemarks: its in a convenient location to the airport, not far restaurants and malls.
review.negativeRemarks: they could modernize the tv's and other things in the room.
review.locationRemarks: 20 minutes from at and t ball park, right down the street from the airport and down town south san francisco. 15 minutes from tanforan mall

review.title: Standard airport hotel
review.reviewText: We had low expectations but was ok for a hotel room close to the airport. The one problem was that there was no hot water for the shower which is a basic need. For this reason alone, we would not stay here again.

review.title: Really close to the airport and freeway.
review.reviewText:
It was not a bad place, I just think that it needs an upgrade. The beds were old. 
Great for a single person.
Not ideal for families.

review.title: Best hotel for the lowest price
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff.  They went above and beyond and its great to see that.
review.negativeRemarks: The continental breakfast could be improved, but it was great to have it period.

review.title: FAr from everything
review.reviewText: No that good  elevetor no good breakfasts no that good
Person person tried to make us feel like we were possible criminals. Not a welcome guest feeling.
review.negativeRemarks: Check procedure

review.title: Exactly what we needed
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, quiet and exactly what we needed for our trip to San Francisco. We were very suprised at how large the room was and the bed was super comfy.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Unfortunatelly rental cars are not permitted for free parking. I had to pay $7.77. There is only one elevator. So you have to wait a while..
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator

review.reviewText: Couldn't find the booking at check in then told us we were scheduled to check out a day earlier so had to make a special trip back to work things out. Pretty much a place to lay your head but not worth the money. The "breakfast" provided was choice of bagels or cereal and juice or coffee. Was also disappointed in that fact as we were expecting a full breakfast like other hotels offer when they state breakfast and don't mention continental

review.title: Wasn't worth the price
review.reviewText: It was very small and really run down. Nice updated bathroom sink, but the bathroom was small and really needs updating.

Good Hotel and really good price.
Near the Airport and with parking lot.
Simple breakfast but fresh.
My main complain was the hard bed, it was uncomfortable and did not have a comforter so the nights felt cold.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were spacious and the staff were polite and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Make the beds more comfortable

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price. Nothing fancy but the room was clean and the front desk lady was very professional and nice.

review.title: Hotell before vacation
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable everyone was helpful and it was very nice to be able to park there in the basement area for the duration of our vacation until we return

review.title: Pretty good for the price
review.reviewText: Nothing too fancy but nice place to stay and the area seems safe too. Would definately stay there again. Really close to the airport so that is a plus.

review.title: Convenient location yet poorly maintained facility
review.reviewText: Took more than 10 minutes for hotel staff to figure out how to check me in. Hotel room with a big mosquito flying around that I had to kill, hairs in the bathtub, and cookie crumbles on the carpret. Bad experience overall. Rather pay more to have a more decent stay.

review.title: scary..
review.reviewText: Very run down, scary.. don't stay by yourself... There are holes in the walls.. window wont open.. tv is very fuzzy.. bed was not clean.. ONE light worked by the bed. Hangers had gross stuff on them..
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco

review.title: Good room for the price
review.reviewText: Basic amenities, clean room, no in-house restaurant, plenty of restaurants nearby, polite courteous staff.

review.title: Close to SFO with free shuttle
review.reviewText: This is a bare bones hotel with no amenities.  Very basic continental breakfast. Location is the strong point here and the price point is right.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a few items to the complimentary breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Denny's is a short walk away.  Also a wendy's close by

review.title: choose another hotel
review.reviewText:
* price changed same day from $84 to $123 due to demand (raised price same day because they could)

* under-staffed --- could not even get decent directions from them --- long hold and wait times

* very dated facility --- plaster falling off wall in my room and carpet torn --- no bedspreads --- old style elevator

* left a very important item at the front desk which should have been immediately returned to me or upon check-out but was not...now I must beg them to mail it back to me... they will not fedex it even if I pay the charge even though it was their error for not returning it to me in the first place

* high noise levels throughout the night --- could not even get a decent night's sleep

* my worst hotel experience ever
review.positiveRemarks: absolutely nothing...would never stay there again and do not recommend it
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: near sfo

review.title: 1st room dirty 2nd rm very dreary
review.reviewText: Was late wirh breakfest stale bagels and old fruit wrong lids for coffee cups

Staff overall great 
Room keys didn't work. After multiple trip to the front desk.  Staff  had to open  room  with master  key.  Aftert the key issue was delt with i  had a good experience.

review.title: Get a remodeled room
review.reviewText: I took a tour before going and they showed me their nice, remodeled rooms. When I got there I got a no frill, less comfort room. Needed better bedding and lots of dent and scratch repairs needed to walls, furniture and doors. No TV guide either. Wifi was good and I did take a long bath which was the highlight of my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was nice. Quick check in and out.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything about that room #316. They should not charge for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, near highway.

review.title: Close to SFO, fairly cheap
review.reviewText: Staff was helpful.  Room is small, vanity is microscopic, lacking shelving and counter surfaces.  Breakfast minimal.  Still, as cheap as can be done, I guess, clean, and served our needs.
review.negativeRemarks:
Room doors close with loud noise, enough to wake you.
Not sure if there is a charge for parking; I didn't pay any, but a sign indicated a fee.
review.locationRemarks: Not near much, except a large high-voltage power line (I requested a room on the side away from it).

review.title: Uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Small room for price air conditioner noop not enough towels shower drip all night

review.title: Not worth the price paid
review.reviewText: Old furniture and equipment. Windows are not tight. Very loud. What you see seems to be clean but not into details. Would fail at a hygienic test.

review.title: Decent hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Everything went well, except that A/C unit was not working.  Continental breakfast could have been a little better. Parking fee was a little higher than advertised on Expedia ($7.xx instead of $5).
review.negativeRemarks: A/C units operational and breakfast.

review.title: Reasonable hotel, very close to airport.
review.reviewText: Just what I needed for one night stay before an early departure at SFO. Complimentary shuttle to and from the airport was fast and very punctual. Staff was friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Not close to restaurants, without a considerable walk across a busy intersection.
review.locationRemarks: Did not consider leaving the area, as walking was difficult, distance as well as crowding traffic.

review.title: Very old elevator that didn't work very well.
review.reviewText: Continental breakfast sucked and the person handling the bagels and food never wore any gloves for sanitation reasons.  Not many amenities and the rooms were suppose to be newly renovated.

It's very close to the airport. It takes only 10 mins! It's affordable and good to stay one night if you need to go to the airport the next day. Breakfast was not bad especially you're rushing you can just grap some food. I can't access wifi though. The signal was too weak I don't know it's different room by room.

Hotel staff was hard to communicate with because they spoke broken English. The room was dirty. The sheets had a dirty odor like they were not washed and the bathroom was filthy! First and last time I will ever stay at this hotel.

review.title: Raised Charges/Fees
review.reviewText: The Expedia website said $20 fee for a dog, I was charged $30 and $5 parking fee and I was charged $7.50. I was returning to my room with continential breakfast and dropped my spoon. I started to go back and get another one, but a hotel staff person said she would bring me one...never did. Ice machine was out of order, should have had ice in office for customers.

review.title: An alternative to expensive 3 stars hotels in down
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel close to airport after discovering how expensive were hotels in downtown and the transport options available from airport to downtown SF.  Officially 2 stars (?), but it feels more like a 3 stars hotel for me.  Really comfortable rooms.  Free airport shuttle which connects to BART trains to Downtown.  The only complaint is the noise of renovation during the day, but if you are out the day, it is no big deal.  There isn't much around except for a Denny restaurant and a convenience store but many restaurants do deliveries till 3am, and again, getting to Downtown is relatively easy.

review.title: Litany of problems
review.reviewText:
No water for half a day.
No hot water for shower on one day.
Charged for parking.
Elevator not working.

review.title: The aire conditioner sounded like a jet engine
review.reviewText:
I complained three times. Finally they repaired the issue on the third day. I really could have used the sleep that I lost when the fan would go or the room would be too stuffy, hot or cold.

Lots of noisy people slamming doors in the hallways I got the impression that these folks were there as part of a program.

In general a lot of things had been jerry rigged, the place really was filthy--doors, floor, tables and bathroom had not been wiped down in a long time.

I think the family that is managing the place wants to do a good job, they just don't understand the investment required to get repeat business.

I would not go back and already have mentioned the condition to other travelers.

The final straw was the security. The doors are blocked open by what seems to be people from  a program who are there permanently. They stand outside to smoke.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, noise level, security is really lacking. People block the door open so that they can go outside to smoke.

review.title: NEVER BOOK  IN THIS HOTEL
review.reviewText: Room is stinky. You'll be shock to get a USD 7.70 car parking fee per day that was not disclosed during reservation & booking process.

review.title: Maybe if you are staying 1 night? MAYBE, just dont
review.reviewText:
Everything was booked. I didn't have much of a choice. And I was there 3 days, and I switched rooms 3 times.
First room, the toilet flush stopped working by the end of the day. The TV didn't work here at all.
Second rooms the Bath tub stopped working. There was no remote for the TV.
Third room, the AC / Heater was erratic. The TV reception crapped out intermittently. 
There is a parking fee per night? No one told me about that beforehand.
No shampoos, no conditioners..
Breakfast was sad, just sad. bagel and cereal, that's it.
Security was non existent, people propped open all the doors around the hotel all night long and that;s how they stayed.
The comforters were as thick as the bed sheets, non existent. 
Still waiting on them to take off the $150+ deposit they charged on my credit card.

review.title: smell like  marijuana not enough breakfast choices
review.reviewText: back door does not work told the manager did not get fixed they should not charge for parking they need to add more stuff for breakfast rooms need to be more cleaner

It was a great short visit with My Husband & 2 sons. The boys had a great time & loved The Continental Breakfast. 
Thanks

review.title: Stay away from it
review.reviewText:
.There was no refrigerator, no microwave, no anything!
There was one desk with one chair, but that is NOT enough for four people, let alone two!
The blankets didn't even look like proper blankets. When I first walked into the room, I thought they forgot to give us blankets.
In addition, both of the key cards they gave us didn't work properly. We had to swipe around 10 times before we were able to get access to the room. 
The breakfast was terrible there; there were very few choices, and they were all pretty unappetizing.
Some of the employees there didn't even speak English. 
The coffee inside the room only gave one bag of caffeinated coffee and one bag of decaf. What happens if multiple people want coffee?! What if all of us want caffeinated coffee?!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: There's a Dennys to eat at instead because their breakfast sucks.

review.reviewText: Cheap and nice place to stay. Close to bus station and train station.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Our toilet broke twice, and the first time we were out ALL DAY and they only fixed our toilet once we were back! They also don't have tiny conditioner, which is weird but whatever. The Italian place that delivers (you get a menu automatically) isn't bad. The continental breakfast is pretty bare and has weird hours. There was also a funky smell in the room when we first got there. And there was this room that constantly smelled like weed! Gross.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds don't have comforters. The continental breakfast could use some waffles or bacon and eggs or SOMETHING.
review.locationRemarks: It's right by the freeway, so if you're just going to other places in the Bay Area, that isn't so bad. A lot of restaurants deliver.

review.title: $20 Pet Fee, $5 Parking Fee
review.reviewText:
Stayed on Xmas Eve. Several rooms partied until almost dawn. Booked here as assured no pet fee but had to pay $20 for our dog and $5 for parking at a MOTEL! Room was average for a cheap motel. A little damage here or there. TV was a tiny flat screen with poor reception. $70 room booked here turned into $100.

Hallway had several bags of overflowing party food, bottles.

Would not recommend this hotel/motel.
review.locationRemarks: Airport is close.

review.title: Very good location, but not very suitable
review.reviewText: We to beg the staff for yhr room to get clean. One towel for three persons. Some days no shompoo in bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Changing the entire management . Can you believe here in US soutn San Francisco there would be house keeping not be able to speak english

review.title: Great staff, good room. Not old at all
review.reviewText: I was able to check in at 9 AM! The staff was kind enough to find a nice and comfy room for me to check in early. Not sure what her name was but shes so sweet! Great customer service. Hallways kind old school but the rooms are def. not as bad as i thought itd be. Flat screen TV, comfy bed. They are remodeling. Def better than Travelodge.
review.negativeRemarks: everything was great
review.locationRemarks: Near by dennys, ihop, and freeways! Not to mention airport

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is okay, nothing special but serves its purpose. Free breakfast and cheap rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Noise

review.title: Needs some work to justify cost.
review.reviewText: Did not have towels in room upon arrival. "Breakfast" is more of a snack than a meal, nothing hot just bagels and cereal. Could never cool room off with A/C on full cold. Sheets and comforter very thin like hotels in the 1990's. Staff was friendly and hotel shuttle was on time.

review.title: Works if you're on a budget
review.reviewText: Only complaints, no microwave and no refrigerator.

review.title: A lot of construction going on!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel has is so called going through an upgrade, but it still looks bad.  First, the hotel hallway on our floor had huge stains while walking to our room.  Once we got to our room, it smelled like someone had been smoking in it and it also smelled like paint.  The bathroom had one large towel and one small towel, no toiletries, and the tub had caulking stains all around.  The plate to the electrical plug where I wanted to charge my phone was missing.  Overall I would not recommend this place unless you are just passing by and want a quick rest.

review.title: Very nice and friendly front desk personal
review.reviewText: Was a great experience!, This hotel was a good recomendation. The lady in charge of the complimentary breakfast was kind of unpolite and rude, but with the rest of the staf everything was great!
review.positiveRemarks: It's renovated, it's clean, comfortable, the elevator was kind of old, but fine. Great place.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was very good!
review.locationRemarks: Well, San Francisco, San Bruno, everything was close and I love the area!

review.title: Okay for a place to stay while going around S.F.
review.reviewText: This place can use a lot of remodeling but for the price, it is okay.  It is a fair deal.  Front desk staff is friendly.  They do charge for parking now.  Parking used to be free but not anymore.  Still a small price to pay comparing to the hotels nearby.  Breakfast included.  Although kind of simple and not much choice, it is still a good breakfast.  Again, for the money we paid and what we get, it is fair.
review.positiveRemarks: Near San Francisco and the airport.  Have breakfast, free Wifi, plenty of parking.  They do charge for parking now.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs a lot of remodeling.  Old everything.  You can tell the age the moment you entered the hallway.  Very old carpet.
review.locationRemarks: Just the airport.  Close to freeway.

review.title: it served our purpose.
review.reviewText: the units was small, the internet does not work within the room. the house computer will shut down without warning while in use.
review.negativeRemarks: there is room for improvement even the floor had water on it from the leaking ice machine.
review.locationRemarks: the hotel is located within an excellent shopping area

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco downtown etc....
review.reviewText: I highly  recomend this hotel because it's clean , and the service is excellent, the people @ the front desk are friendly
room is ok, big and clean. elevator sign not very clearly. plentiful of parking lot. breakfast included but very simple.

review.title: Hotel SFO
review.reviewText: It is a good hotel for a very reasonable price. The hotel staff was very nice and was able to upgrade my room for no charge. The hotel is very close to the airport and can be easily reached by the city bus route. The only thing that I'd say was a let down was the fact that its so far from Downtown. Even then the San Bruno BART station is only about a 30 minute walk or you can also take a bus route into town. Other than that, I was very pleased with my stay!

review.title: Hotel in South San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little dated, but for the most part fine.  It was clean.  It is on a busy road that can be a bit loud.  There is a bus stop close.  CalTrain is a bit farther (1 mile) and BART is closer to 1.5 miles away.  I had to fix the auto program on the TV to get more than 3 channels.  Not 5 star, but overall it is inexpensive and acceptable.

review.title: A place to sleep with access to airport shuttle
review.reviewText: If you are just looking for a place to sleep before a flight it's acceptable
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby was pleasant and the staff efficient
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are very small and dreary with very few amenities nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Quick access to San Franciso airport

review.title: Cheap hotel close to highway
review.reviewText:
Tried to check-in an hour early (2:00pm) and agent said there were no rooms available. There were four other guests also trying to check in.  Don't understand if checkout is at 11:00am, why rooms cannot be ready by 2:00pm.  

Agent was very short with the client before me who was trying to get the hotel's wi-fyi password.  Instead of writing it down for the guest she continued to yell it out.  That was painful to watch.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed mattress was unbearable, very hard.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Dennys.

review.title: Do not go
review.reviewText: Noisy in the night time with slamming doors, people shouting and rolling carts. I did not get any sleep it was horrible. This was ground floor. They did move us a floor up when we asked next day. No noise , but no more wifi there neither. Had to use computer in lobby, that kept on throwing me out the system. Then there was this tiny breakfast room where a lot of people didn't fit in. I strongly advise not to go here.

review.title: Don't stay here...
review.reviewText: Small rooms they say it's a queen bed but it's a double.. Raccoons will scratch at your window all night long I mean a lot of them I looked out the window to investigate and saw no joke 20 of them. Also we heard doors slam all night long keeping is up. All for a low price of 140 bucks a night what a joke don't stay here...
good job. very clean. very nice staffs. very nice location.

review.title: Good place to stay for an early flight
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable.  Close to the airport with a free shuttle.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to the airport with a free early morning shuttle
review.locationRemarks: Great airport location

review.title: Nice,clean, very comfortable hotel! Close to SFO!
review.reviewText: Check-in was very quick. Clerk was very friendly! Room was clean and the bed was awesome! We were very tired after our two week vacation and we were very happy with our accomadations! And glad we didn't have far to go to return our rental car! Thanks!

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay when needing to catch a flight the next day.

review.title: Convenient and spacious rooms
review.reviewText: Our first day we checked in and then turned on the air conditioner before we left for sightseeing and a ballgame, as it was warm and stuffy in the room. When we returned at midnight the air conditioner had leaked and the carpet was soaked. Unfortunately a couple bags had been sitting close enough to get wet in the puddle. As it was late we put the ice bucket under to catch the drips and then asked for a different room the next morning. The hotel was full and nothing was available until the afternoon. We were going out for the day and evening and not returning again until late. So the Manager asked us to load our stuff onto a luggage cart and then when the new room was ready they would move our stuff in for us.  This worked out fine and except for the inconvenience of having to repack and unpack again everything worked out just fine.  The rooms are a good size with lots of floor space. My only complaint is lack of plug-ins but otherwise the hotel is clean and pleasant with fantastic staff. We were there for 4 nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, spacious rooms. Very helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of plug-ins and noise level in the hallways as wheeled luggage and heels on the tile floor echo a lot.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Airport and within walking distance to caltrain.

review.title: Saturated With Cigarette Smoke
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were wonderful, as were the housekeeping staff. The room I was issued was saturated with cigarette smoke! When I first opened the door I actually lurched backwards and started gagging. All the bedding reeked and by the following morning all my clothing in and out of my luggage smelled like cigarettes. I showered to get it out of my hair but my clothing reeked so badly the rest of my trip to Ohio was just awful!!!

I would not recommend this hotel and will never stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks:
Stop advertising the rooms as non-smoking or remove the carpeting, re-paint and enforce non-smoking rule.
Replace splintered & damaged door moldings.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel needs a little upgrading but is staffed by very nice people.  Kept clean and they are very accommodating

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: I needed a place to stay that was close to the airport and with shuttle transportation. Hotel Focus was great! And the price on Expedia wasn't all that bad. I was picked up from SFO and also dropped back off in the morning. The room was updated( I stayed on the second floor) flat screen TV, desk, shower/tub,bed was comfy with no stains. I think maybe the bathroom needed a little color. All white is not my thing. It's a little small but that didnt bother me. Sink on the outside of the bathroom which is like other places I've stayed in SF. Overall I was pleased with my stay. There's also a gas station, Starbucks and Wendy's a block away which I thought was a plus.

review.title: Ok place
review.reviewText: It was an ok place for a first night after landing late at SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Light bulbs did not all function in the room..
review.locationRemarks: It is close to SFO

review.title: old hotel wthout any comfort but expansive
review.reviewText: no hangers and no telefone in the room, just one light, dirty WC, they didnt find the reservation by expedia in the PC and we had to show it on my tablet, they promised to change the situation, but nothing hapened, breakfastroom small and always overcrowded, breakfast minimum offers
review.positiveRemarks: there is a shuttle to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: there is only a DENYS five minutes walking, but you have to pass the highway and a bridge.Inthe night it is mot recommandable

review.title: Based on price, I was expecting more high end room
review.reviewText: Reminded me of a cheaper motel.. but it was clean enough and hotel staff was great.

review.title: More like a Motel
review.reviewText:
Arrived at location, there were 2 dozen bikers staying there with loud motorcycles.
Tried to check in, Clerk was not very attentive, also tried to charge for parking which was stated free on expedia.
Room is very disappointing, bedsheets of low quality, no power outlet by bed, bathroom had plumbing noises every 10 minutes. 

Overall,
would rather pay more for a better hotel, would not come back.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SF airport

review.title: The hotel was away from the city
review.reviewText: I got woken up at 1:30 am to the sound of the bathroom flooding. My experience sucked

review.title: Cheap...quick fix remodel
review.reviewText: Pictures look good on internet however remodel looks cheap and done sloppy....seen excess grout just left in restroom...could hear everything!...people just walking in walkway. Not only that you still have to pay for parking!
review.positiveRemarks: Near airport and easy access to freeway
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel not pay for parking

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated near the airport but surprisingly you don't hear the airport noise. The rooms are decent size but they are in dire need of renovating. The beds are average in terms of comfort, but lighting is poor as there is only one lamp on one the side of the bed. There is no shower cap available even in the vending machine so my wife had to wrap her hair in a towel to take a shower. Breakfast? don't get me started. It is a joke. Only plus was lack of noise at night and shower drain that did not get clogged. It is advertised that parking is free, however they charged $5/night. Elevator never worked.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is friendly. Quiet room.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Near all other airport hotels and very close to the 101.

review.title: Hotel was ok
review.reviewText:
Room were clean and freindly staff
easy check in but no good breakfast.

review.title: Its a cover up
review.reviewText: So I remember stayin at this place some years ago. They have since changed their name and look. It was so gross our shower had hair in the tub as if no one came to clean. I was not happy but we needed a quick room. Never  again.
review.negativeRemarks: The entire building
review.locationRemarks: Nothing but cops crawling up and down the street made it hard for me to want to leave.

review.title: I cannot remember staying in a more shabby hotel.
review.reviewText: This hotel does not belong on list of hotels offered by Expedia! It is so bad, I actually took pictures. Pictures of the hole in the bathroom door, the hole surrounding the shower head plumbing, the patches of unmatching wall paint, of the electrical outlets hanging off the wall, the snowy tv reception, the missing hanger pole in the closet, the sloppy wall plaster work, the uncleanliness of the bathroom, etc. etc. etc. What a disaster of a room. The lobby and staff were just fine, but the room a huge disappointment. And all of this for something just short of $200.00!!!!!!!!!!! They need to do a major renovation or tear the place down. I have stayed in some other SFO convenient hotels before, and some were pretty mediochre, but this one is likely the tackiest hotel I have ever stayed in. Don't be fooled by the price and location, this hotel is a mess.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was ok!
review.negativeRemarks: Don't get me started, just see above remarks.

review.title: Marginal at best
review.reviewText: Very very basic- hard bed-could feel the springs.  Breakfast was a joke- few rolls and cold/hot cereal

review.title: Clean reasonable close to airport
review.reviewText: In process of being updated clean and comfortable. Continential breakfast not that rememberable. Staff very friendly.

review.title: It is an unusual experience
review.reviewText:
Did not expect to see a large size, but relatively empty bathroom. The bathroom has one toilet and one shower. It has concrete floor. Looks like an unfinished one. The wifi is really weak, almost unusable and the front desk clerk had no clue.

Otherwise, the room was comfortable with a microwave and a small refrigerator. The room rate is really low.

review.title: Clean comfortable room
review.reviewText: The room was clean, comfortable, nothing really fancy.  Elevator was kinda strange but overall I wanted a decent inexpensive place to lay my head and I got it.

review.title: Our experience
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly. Breakfast was ok. I am a tea drinker and only green tea was available that was a big problem for me. Room we stayed requires little TLC. If they can add small fridge and microwave will make stay much better. Close to San Francisco international airport and about 25 minute from d/town which is plus.

review.title: Convenient location affordable price
review.reviewText: Quality price not bad. Clean. breakfast is terrible

review.title: Practical, cheap hotel near to the airport.
review.reviewText:
This is a cheap hotel which is ideal when you require a bed for the night close to the airport, it is not luxurious but it is clean and comfortable with friendly helpful staff, we did not try the breakfast that was offered but opted to use the ihop across the road.
The hotel is positioned near a busy road so there is a bit of noise from outside but nothing too bad!
review.positiveRemarks: Value for money and close proximity to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor and furnishings could possibly be tidied up!
review.locationRemarks: A 1hour $2 bus journey takes you into the heart of San Francisco, alternatively you can take the courtesy bus to the airport to catch your flight.

review.title: Hotel close to SFO airport.
review.reviewText: Not a bad experience overall.  Good hotel to stay in and close to the airport with free shuttle to and from. Good hotel to stay in if you're renting a car to do sightseeing in San Francisco and surrounding areas as they have free parking.  Breakfast was included and not bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The free shuttle back and forth to the airport (SFO) and the close proximity to the airport. Also free parking as we rented a car.
review.negativeRemarks: Disappointed there was no ironing board in the room.  Had to ask for the iron also.  Also, no hair dryer. Thought these would be included.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport (SFO) approx 10 minutes drive by car .  Mostly industrial area with not much to do.

review.title: close to S.F. airport with fast shuttle service
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to the S.F. airport (less then 10 min.) the shuttle service runs every half hour, the beds are comfortable, and the rooms are clean, the down side is the rooms are small, so are the T.V's, if you don't have a rental car there's no place to walk to to eat, very over priced for a one night stay close to airport, they do however have a computer & printer for boarding pass printing that saves time at the airport check-in
review.positiveRemarks: The beds are comfortable, rooms are clean
review.negativeRemarks: larger T.V., better shower heads
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed overnight, was no close place to walk to to eat other than Wendy's, nothing to see because it is in the industrial area of South S.F.

review.title: Not so good.
review.reviewText: The bed was horrible. Too hard and very squeaky!!!! With the most softest move, the bed made a loud squeeking noise. There was no microwave. Room service woke us up at 9:00am. Ridiculous!

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText: Sheets and blankets on the beds were thin, visibly dirty, and found hair in them as well. This was the WORST part. Didn't feel comfortable sleeping at all. The toilet was cracked, bathroom tiles dirty, and there was a big random hole in the wall in the room. Continental breakfast was little boxes of cereal and oatmeal. Stairwells smell strongly of bleach. Was supposed to stay 2 nights, checked out early after 1. Very disappointing experience overall. Lots of available parking though, and fairly easy access to the freeway.

review.title: Easy Freeway Access
review.reviewText: It was ok. The room was clean. When I saw the room photos online I thought the room would be bigger. The compimentary breakfasts and coffee were really great in the morning. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would likely visit again.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway and restaurants especially if you like pizza & shopping.

review.title: Security is an issue here
review.reviewText: Room doors were not secure, surrounding area was questionable. Facility is partially remodeled, but not well. Bathroom was below par.
The continental breakfast was very sparse.  Elevator floor had some kind of liquid spilled on it.  The WiFi didn't work
review.negativeRemarks: more assistance with wifi

review.title: Reservation cancelled
review.reviewText:
When guest arrived was told room had been cancelled and they were booked. Attendent was
rude and unwilling to help. I called expedia and they confirmed my reservation was not cancelled and offered to call hotel. I was put on hold and in the mean time the guest called me and said
she was offered a room by another guest. When expedia called me back she said she had
talked to attendent and everything was OK and my guest would be given a room.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good value hotel.  Simple and quiet. Ideal for cost conscious customers.

review.title: Last min trip to SF
review.reviewText: If u r stayin or just neec a place to fly out in a day go for it.  The price is not justified for room.  It was a last min trip so had no choice. Would not stay there again.  Learned my lesson.  Hotel does provide a nitch.   Just that nitch is not for a family but would say male traveler only.

review.title: Ok hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Close to the airport. It affordable compared to other hotels around.

review.title: Stay away!!!!
review.reviewText: No rod for toilet paper, no comforter, bath tub leeked all night. Stains in the sheets. Doors were really thin and you could hear everything going on outside. Got the place last minute and it was really overpriced for the condition it was in. Only 2 pillows. Breakfast was terrible. The only good thing was the receptionist in the morning was really friendly and helpful

review.title: Good value for money.
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful, bus into San Francisco stops just down road although 45 min journey. Slight minus is breakfast very basic and not enough seating when busy. Overall fine hotel near airport with free shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: bus into San Francisco stops just down road although 45 min journey. near airport with free shuttle

review.title: Close to airport & High voltage power cable
review.reviewText:
Hotel is close to SFO. 
It is a old hotel with (partial) renovation. 
High voltage electrical cables pass over the hotel parking ground and you can hear noise from the cables. 
Staying under the high voltage cable will not be good for health. 
If I knew that the cable passes by, I will not chose the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, cleaness of the room.

review.title: Ok, but needs improvements
review.reviewText: For 4 people, not enough towels, breakfast was like being in a grocery store

review.title: Noisy night
review.reviewText:
The room was a little small with not much furniture, but the room was clean and comfortable.
The only problem was a very noisy group of kids arrived around 11:30 pm and was running up and down the halls yelling and talking loud. I personally made two calls to the front desk and was told they would be quiet in 5 minutes. 30 minutes later I called asking for someone to come tot he per floor and quiet these kids down and have them go to their rooms, no luck no one came up.
the next morning there was 25  kids in the cafe milling around talking and just being in the way. 
Being there for business I did not have a lot of time to spend waiting for them to get their meal and get out of the way for others.
review.negativeRemarks: Try to keep the noise down after 10:00 pm
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: The hotel was very clean and accessible.
review.reviewText: The hotel was near restaurants, so I went out for dinner.  I did have some trouble sleeping due to the outside freeway and noisy air conditioner.  I don't know what you could do about that.  All in all was very nice and affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Some how have a quieter air conditioner.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, airport.

review.title: Horrible Hotel
review.reviewText: First when you get into the hotel room, you will nto find any place to put your cloths and so on since there are no closets or dresser draws or dressers. The sink is no larger the 2 foot by 2 foot and barely a place to put your tooth brush on and nothing else. you can hear people who are in room next to you talking and people above you walking around their room like if the ceiling is going to cave in.  The beds are the hardest beds me and my friend ever slept on with the hardest pillows. The Bed cover was as thin as the sheets on the bed.  So have fun staying warm. The bathroom is so small if you are large at all have fun going to the restroom if you have any guest. The tv was a 20" TV... Seriously? most hotels in these days have 40 . They rooms are small and looks like it could have been been for the homeless at one time and getting out to becoming a real hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Parking... and Staff was cool
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to and from the airport and to San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Limited room space, broken  blow dryer , no microwave , no refrigerator , aircon not working properly

review.title: Close to airport, but not a great hotel
review.reviewText: Small bathroom.  Outdated, bathtub tiny.  Bathroom tiny. No fridge no microwave.  Ok for a one night stay, but would never recommend staying there again.  The elevator is like nothing I have seen before.   The pictures are much better than the rooms actually are.
review.negativeRemarks: Adding fridge, microwave.   Lower the price for the quality of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do near by just a close hotel to airport.

review.title: Budget hotel, close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Not the best, not the worst. It was a cheap place to stay close to the airport.

review.title: Smelly room
review.reviewText: Smelly rooms that haven't been updated since the 50s

review.title: Hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
We looked for a hotel with reasonable rates for the last days of our US trip before we flew out of San Francisco.
The hotel offered the vicinity to the airport (yes, you hear the noise from the airport) and the price we were willing to pay. 
We used it as starting point for day trips into San Francisco and Muir Beach. 
The city center is reachable within 30 min by car.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean and the staff very responsive to any requests we had.

review.title: Very reasonable hotel for one night stay
review.reviewText: Clean, fast, close to the airport. Very reasonable hotel for a one night sleep before catching a early flight. Exactly meet my expectation for a convenient inn. Would be even better if there's comforter instead of blanket that is literally made of foam.

review.title: Airport Shuttle Unreliable
review.reviewText: Chosen due to close proximity to SFO Airport and airport shuttle. Rooms seemed clean, front desk staff friendly. Signed up for morning shuttle which was late (>25 minutes) luckily there was a cab driver at the hotel who agreed to take us. Very disappointed

review.title: Remodel in progress
review.reviewText: Older hotel undergoing remodel with nice improvements to bathrooms, sink and carpet. No lamps by bed. Holes left in walls from pictures and lamps being removed. No pictures rehung on walls. Bath towels were very small and very thin. Mattress on king bed was very firm and not a good night sleep. I hope our room was not finished being remodeled.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price and close to CalTrain.

review.title: Hotel Focus SFO - is really a MOTEL (bad one)
review.reviewText: Old hotel, next to noisy airport, staff who spoke primarily Spanish. We had a broken toilet which maintenance man couldn't fix and promised to move our luggage to another room since we had to leave and couldn't wait for him. He moved our luggage but didn't tell front desk to where...had to go search when we return at midnight. .Dirty room. Really this is a bad motel, not even worth close to the money paid.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything should be improved.

review.title: Cheap hotel for quick stay.
review.reviewText: If staying with family , I would not recommend this place.

review.title: The worst Hotel I have aver stayed.
review.reviewText: I always look for something cheap if I am not going to stay in the hotel very much, but there are minimum expectations for a hotel which in this case were not met. The wi-fi never worked during the 4 days I stayed. The tub and sink were clogged. The cards to open the room door, you had to try several times before opening. same to close the door, several times to make sure that it was closed. The continental breakfast was terrible. So I had preferred they had not offered continental breakfast or wi-fi. I even booked another hotel for one night to have a "decent" stay for at least one night and have access to internet. The room did not even have a cooler or microwave which in most cases you would get for this price. Very disappointing that Expedia even has this hotel listed. I would rate it with minus 2 stars. The only good thing about this hotel is that the staff try to to the best with the so few resources they have.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the Bay/Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Expedia rating system doesn't allow for half points, but I would give an overall rating of this hotel as a 3.5 if the rating system allowed. This is an older hotel with easy freeway access to the Bay and Downtown San Francisco with a "family" feel, but despite its age, the in-room free Wi-Fi was excellent - better than some more modern hotels I have stayed in within the last couple of months. There is a continental breakfast included with your stay and parking is free - another plus for this hotel's location. There are several different types of restaurants literally across the street from the hotel, so you have your choice of a reasonable nice sit-down dinner or a fast food run if you prefer. Staff is very hospitable with a good sense of humor. It is a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the free in-room Wi-Fi access, free parking, the included continental breakfast, and the quaint "family" feel of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Since the hotel is off the freeway & close to the Bay/Downtown San Francisco, there is a multitude of things to do including having a sit-down dinner.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: Dirty room unfriendly staff... close to the airport only advantage. .

review.title: Good budget hotel
review.reviewText: Room was decent, undergoing re-furbishing. The wi-fi needs lots of improvement. Overall decent budget hotel with fair location.

review.title: It was disappointing.
review.reviewText: My daughter and I booked this room ahead of time. We arrived to the hotel late in the evening. We drove into the parking lot and all I could focus on was the rotting A/C unints on the windows. The covers were missing on most of them. I thought to myself surely those rooms were not being used. My first thought was the little rodents that could climb in. I had already booked the room for two nights....Our room was not very big at all. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. The 2nd morning when we were packing to leave I noticed light coming in through our window A/C unit. I was disgusted to realize that our room had one of those rotting A/C units.
