It just gave me chills to know that we slept in that room with the hole in the unit. The facility was having new windows put in and seemed to be in the process of remodeling. I thought the rotting A/C units should of been first on the list though.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean. The staff was friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace rotting window A/C units!

review.title: Crappy hotel
review.reviewText:
My first step into this hotel made me wonder "Am I in the right hotel as the one shown in the nice pictures"?
Lobby is very small, building and room facilities are very old. For the price paid, this hotel is not worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: The shower power is great. Pillow and quilt are clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel price overpriced the hotel quality.
review.locationRemarks: not much.

review.title: Working persons
review.reviewText:
Would have been better if told there was going to be remodeling of course the person tried to help to accommodate, but Jack hammering was a little to loud, because we worked nights. We slept during the day.
Other wise it was OK. Better off letting people know about remodeling.
review.negativeRemarks: short of help

review.title: the pictures of the hotel do not fit what it actua
review.reviewText:
I was expecting a clean room and location that was depicted in the ads. The first room smelled of mildew from the carpet in the hallway and room. One bed was in a corner with no room on either side of it. The screen was taped up and you couldn't open that window. The other window had no screen and the windows were filthy.
The TV sound did not work and the toilet paper was soaked. I was told they were sold out but refused to stay in that room. By some miracle they had one of the other rooms available that was recently redone. Of course that room only had 1 Queen bed and we needed two.
They were painting the walls in the lobby and front desk and it stunk of paint. The outdoor seating area is a joke. The hotel is a dump. Not happy with spending $200.for two nights.
review.positiveRemarks: That I got to check out!
review.negativeRemarks: OMG, How about a demolition crew!
review.locationRemarks: Play on Highway 101

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Room small and construction going on. Staff was nice and accommodating

review.title: Refresh
review.reviewText:
I picked the hotel because it was cheap and close to the Airport. It was in the process of being redecorated and although the painters were still working, it did not cause any issues.

It was clean and tidy, provided the minimum requirements and the price was just right.
review.positiveRemarks: Cheap and cheerful and the location was close to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Better TV and program selection.
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and road infrastructure.

review.title: Convenient to airport
review.reviewText: Old buildings but the fresh coat of paint made the room pleasant enough.

review.title: Not worth the money.
review.reviewText: This place is very clearly a low budget hotel, but they charge the same price as other nicer hotels. The place as a whole is pretty dirty, but at least our room was clean. House cleaning thought coming at 9AM both days was a good idea, so make sure you put your Do Not Disturb signs on. The shower has low water pressure. The mattress was rock hard. The TV had maybe 15 channels.

review.title: Cheap but OK
review.reviewText: We had spent so much money on the rest of our trip that we wanted to cut back on the price on our last two nights. This hotel is on the cheap side in price and everything else also. The beds have no real bedspread and the blanket is made of foam rubber. But the bed was comfortable, the tv reception was terrible. The noise was very loud if you opened the window, but then again you are near the airport. The ac worked just fine and the room was clean. breakfast was danish and cereal. To save money it was OK.
review.positiveRemarks: the cleaning staff were very nice
review.negativeRemarks: a real blanket would be nice
review.locationRemarks: it's near the airport that's the only reason you chose this place.

review.title: Nice staff but a poor hotel experience
review.reviewText: I'm used to staying at very low end lodgings, and if the Focus had been half the price and advertised as a hostel I would have counted myself lucky to have found it. The staff was very gracious and my room was clean. However, as even a budget hotel it had too many problems for me to use again. I was told that my room was one of the remodeled ones, but even so the bath tub drain was broken and the toilet needed repairs, and the furniture layout was so poor that there was no room to pull out the chair enough to sit at the desk without colliding with the bed. The desk was clearly a "second", and one of its drawers had been installed upside down! The only outlet away from the bathroom sink was overloaded with four appliances using what looked like a simple adapter covering the two actual outlets with four access points (rather than using a safer power strip). It's possible to have a fresh version of a continental breakfast, but this one had a few pre-packaged, mostly highly sugared items that could have been bought at a convenience store - I skipped it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was lovely and the room was very clean. The bed was comfortable although I did use my own pillow.
review.negativeRemarks: Invest more time and money into the room remodeling: inspect the rooms for the problems I listed above. Get fresh baked goods for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and Highway 101. If one has a car it's a short drive to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel in South San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff are so polite. The beds are comfortable and clean dorms. It is close a lot of nice other cities where you can visit Google, Facebook, Standford

review.title: Close to aeroport
review.reviewText:
We left a pair of shoes in the room and when I call the reception to ask if they can send them
I was told was nothing found in the room ...
The first day the room was not clean and the next day no towels not even one (clean or dirty)so I came out of the shower and had to use a Tshirt and when I went to the reception and ask for towels ... and got one...

review.title: Hotel under renovation
review.reviewText: Painting crew in hallway upon early arrival but finished about 5 pm. Hotel should be about a 2 star after renovation.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff very helpful and even opened the breakfast room early for us.

review.title: good location, normal service, cheap price
review.reviewText: really close to SFO airport, which is why I chose this hotel in the 1st place. nothing spectacular but given the price, I'm satisfied overall, and will come back again

review.title: good location, normal service, cheap price
review.reviewText: really close to SFO airport, which is why I chose this hotel in the 1st place. nothing spectacular but given the price, I'm satisfied overall, and will come back again

review.title: No thank you..
review.reviewText: Our first room nothing worked in. So we had to get another room. Once again nothing worked!! On the third we finally had a tv that worked.. Tv is really small.. Never again

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
It's an old hotel that been renovated, pieces of building material
Is falling off from the facade up above the entrance by going to the
lobby.
I notice some necessary needed repair to the walls by the lobby
The elevator is old, it has a swinging door that could be unsafe for
the pedestrians on the hallway.
Room is very small.
Sink to the bathroom is outside the bathroom, it's by the entrance
of the room, poised a possible health hazard for the occupant's.
Continental breakfast is ok.
The hotel has an easy access from a major thoroughfare and close by
the Freeway 101 north, close to a lots of restaurant and fast food (El
Camino Rd)
If it's only for two and only for sleeping it's ok.

review.title: Great deal for the money!
review.reviewText: I had a great experience. Hotel has free shuttle to airport and is near bus. Room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: The hotel is ok, cheap and breakfast is good.
review.reviewText: The hotel is ok, cheap and breakfast is good. No hassles, stuff are ok.
review.negativeRemarks: At this cheap rate I am not sure how much can more the hotel can provide
review.locationRemarks: near the main road, accessible

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: This is not the most luxurious hotel by any means, but it is conveniently located, clean and the rooms are reasonably sized. It is a good choice for a budget hotel for SF, as it is close to the CalTrain station. It is also about ten minutes to the airport by the hotel's free shuttle.
review.positiveRemarks: Free shuttle to airport, clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was underwhelming.
review.locationRemarks: There's not a lot in South San Francisco itself, but the train ride to SF is less than fifteen minutes.

review.title: Beware!
review.reviewText: It was horrible the picture looks way better than what it really looks like building is missing pieces of wood and paint, bathroom is super tiny no fan, walls were swollen and cracked from water damage, they forgot to put sheets over the mattress no blankets at all! Spend $20 extra else where and get way better room totally not worth it!

review.title: Beautiful new rooms
review.reviewText: The dcor is lovely. The staff pleasant. DO not stay in a room with tile in front of the door when you are near an airport. In the very early morning hours, everyone going past our room wheeling their luggage sounded like the beginning of an earthquake. For 2 hours it went on . Would I stay there again ... Yes!
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to everything we needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet the floor outside the elevator rooms.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco. enough said

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: This hotel came up as an excellent deal on Expedia...however, we have learned our lesson. This hotel is very old and in poor shape. On a positive note, we were pleased with the gentleman at the front desk - his customer service was great.

review.title: Bed squeaked.
review.reviewText: The room fit our need. Location was perfect. Close enough to the city yet away from all the city traffic.

review.title: Bad choice
review.reviewText:
Cheap breakfast
Small room
No intimacy in the bathoom
Bd choice overall

review.title: Cheap. Good if you have an early flight. Poor wifi
review.reviewText: We were there for just on night and we only booked it because it was inexpensive and also had a shuttle at 4 in the morning. The room was clean and decent sized. The big problem was the wifi. It was extremely slow! We used our phone networks for all the internet we needed. The other problem was that we smelled some sort of smoke or something burning at night but then some one from the staff came and used the room freshener in the hallways outside. We got the free shuttle at 4 in the morning which was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Wi-fi
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport

review.title: It was okay...
review.reviewText: I didn't enjoy my stay here at all. The TV didn't work, the walls were dirty and dusty, and the bathroom had stains. It wasn't worth the price.

review.title: Nice and cheap
review.reviewText: Other then the smell they have in the hotel the hotel staff was wonderful accept for one of their housekeepers. Other than that it was nice.

review.title: Slept like I was at Fred Flintstones.
review.reviewText: The elevator door was so strange. The outer door was like a regular room door. The inner door didn't even close all the way. The hotel was located in an out of the way place, so you had to walk a ways to get something to eat. The staff was very good and went out of their way to help you. The room was satisfactory, but the mattress was so hard that I hurt for three days and didn't get a good night's sleep before our 14 & a half hour flight.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs to be remodeled. It needs new comfortable beds.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing near by. You have to walk a half hour across a steep bridge to get something to eat in a less than desirable neighborhood' but good food .

review.title: Awesome hotel
review.reviewText: I have been homeless for about a month n this hotel has been both convertible and affordable for me numerous times now! Would recommend it highly!

review.title: People that next..
review.reviewText:
People that next door was too loud....: (
So I can not sleep well.

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: Hotel is good. It's clean and breakfast is complementary and it's good and healthy. Staff is okay. Price for rooms is okay. There is no iron stand and limited coffee pouches. Only problem is that this hotel stinks like hospital. They have mentioned that they use some kind of chemical for pest controls. AC nobs are loose n need to make sure it is turned on. But for overall it's good if you r not spending much time in hotel.

review.title: Hotel was okay
review.reviewText: The window didn't lock all the way, the blankets were not good and housekeeping seemed to be in a bad mood all the time. However it was a comfortable and a peaceful place.

review.title: Nice walking distance
review.reviewText: The Hotel was pleasing and comfortable. Not a Hilton Inn or The Hyatt but it was OK. The housekeepers didn't understand English, everything with them was a "OK" or a smile.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to the Bar and Grill
review.negativeRemarks: Better environment, Knowledgeable housekeepers and better coffee
review.locationRemarks: There is a Bar and Grill near by and fast foods restaurants

review.title: Ghetto Motel
review.reviewText: This was a hotel in a awful neighborhood. It was also very outdated and in need of a makeover.

review.title: Cheap hotel for a reason.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a shady part of town the closest bart station was 1.5 miles away and was a 30 min walk. Only restaurant within reasonable walking distance was Dennys. The kept the rooms clean and were quick about service but the elevator didn't have a proper door and the stairs were barely lit. it was kinda creepy.

review.title: Solid one-star
review.reviewText:
Bed was good. Breakfast tolerable. Desk clerks were respectful and nice and so were the cleaning staff. However, it was not a good experience staying at this hotel.

First, the room had a musty smell that was quite oppressive. The staff was nice enough to let me check two other rooms. They were all bad. I woke up every morning feeling dirty and smelly.

Second, the toilet was dirty. Dirty with the yucky mess left behind by the previous stay. The crew came in next day and did a good job cleaning up.

Third, one night, I was woken up at 3:15 AM by a loud screaming truck in the back parking lot. The truck driver kept up this up for nearly an hour. Then, there was a thundering noise that shook the hotel. After that all was well except I couldn't go back to sleep.

Other concerns: Bath room has no door, so unsuitable except for a single person. No ironing board or iron available, so get your own. According to the staff, none of the rooms have a mini fridge or microwave in case this is important. The elevator is the type that you see in third world countries with a door that you must pull hard to open.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to the airport and nearby restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Rebuild the hotel.

review.title: Good if you are on low budget
review.reviewText:
Spent 4 nights in this hotel and my overall experience wasn't bad. Stuff did everything to make my stay comfortable. At the moment this was the cheapest hotel in sfo area.
The bottom line is you get what you pay for, perhaps my expectations were less than it turned out to be.
review.positiveRemarks: This place isn't great: everything is old and from the first glance it looks creepy, but they keep renovating rooms and stuff is very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: They might want to get rid of the smell in hallways
review.locationRemarks: Location is great if you have a car

review.title: Does the job
review.reviewText: This hotel is basic. The staff were very friendly and the room was clean (although rather run-down). If you're passing through and need a place close to the airport, this place will work. If you want to see the city, you're out of luck. You'll have to take the airport shuttle to BART since there are no stations nearby, and absolutely nothing else to do.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty much nothing in the vicinity - just a starbucks and a Wendy's.

review.title: Very noisy you can hear people next door.
review.reviewText: It was cheap and I guess you can expect a 5 star treatment for $59/night. If I had to do it over I wouldn't stay there again. Stay away!! Staff is rude.

review.title: Birthday Gift
review.reviewText: One of my nearest and dearest friends expressed an interest in being able to visit San Francisco. I was moving up to the Bay area from San Diego when this conversation was being held. The idea to make not only that desire happen but have a means to see my friend was too good to pass up. So a few days after my move I started researching hotels in the area. I chose Hotel Focus because it was the most central to the sites my friend wanted to visit. It turned out to be not only an affordable pick but also a decent location.

review.title: Clean and comfy
review.reviewText: For the price this hotel gets a 100% in my book. I will definitely be coming back
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price, friendly staff, and home like environment.
review.negativeRemarks: The over all appearance could be updated but not shabby
review.locationRemarks: Right off the free way close to IHOP Denny's mcdonalds Starbucks ect. Great location

review.title: for the price
review.reviewText: it was very clean and you are close to SFO what more do you want for 54 bucks!

review.title: Mixed review!!
review.reviewText: Our overall experience was pretty good the only trouble we had was that their internet went down as we were checking in resulting in an almost 40 minute delay. However! We spent an hour and a half (our choice it was after checkout time) in the lobby at the end of our stay. The poor clerk had nothing but trouble - two separate guests were checked into rooms undergoing renovation. One of them was then placed in a room that had not been properly cleaned. That one elected to not stay there after all. Another guest was also checked into an uncleaned room. Overall I would say the odds of having trouble are fairly high. But we really didn't have any ourselves. And the price was certainly right!

For a small price, I really could not have any complaint. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The airport shuttle was very reliable. The building is a bit old but tolerable. I even got breakfast and late check out with this small price. The wifi was good and you don't need a password. I had stayed at other hotels where I could not connected to the wifi. I definitely will stay at this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, wifi connection and reliable airport shuttle
review.negativeRemarks: nothing really, if they do more remodeling,they could charge more.
review.locationRemarks: not much

review.title: Good experience in here
review.reviewText: The people is very nice and helpful

Hotel front desk female clerk was awesome. Friendly and efficient. Very helpful on where I can walk to a restaurant and if it was safe to do so. The room was nice. TV didn't work but I was to tired to care. The bathroom needed little touch ups on floor. black sticky tile glue came up between cracks and not cleaned off. grimy door by knob in back side. Otherwise very nice. Great hot Lwater right away. I would recommend it to all I know and come again myself. Great having shuttle to airport!
review.negativeRemarks:
door to old elevator. should be removed as it makes it hard to get luggage in by yourself.
I had a lot of luggage. I had to struggle.
review.locationRemarks: nice. near airport.

review.title: You will get what you paid for
review.reviewText:
The rooms are alright but the hotel is at end of the strip and you have to walk more than 15 minutes to get to the heart of the strip.

The room we stayed in had unpleasant smell and the carpets is worn out.

review.title: Near Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: We just want a cheap hotel near airport for an early flight at least on 2 star level. We were not expecting much but the hotel was still a little disappointing. The building looks terrible outside. The room has a little smell, maybe cuz of the renovation of bathroom. I can't recognize but ok. Sink is not in the bathroom but next to the door. The water spout didn't work because they forgot to switch on the tube. And they didn't believe me no water there until they came to see. They have breakfast in the public room and complimentary shuttle to airport, which is good. But somehow they screwed up the shuttle schedule making us waiting for 20 mins until they called a taxi. It's ok for one night stay and it's cheap. But I will try different place next time.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Saw this thinking "hey near a seminar and for $47 each night...how bad can it be?"... Well it is bad. Took three rooms to get one that worked....locks on doors should work, heater, especially in San Fran needs to work, but even third room showed signs of old sheets...don't think they wash them...just remake bed with what's on them. Bed had oil on sheets.... Just spend more and go where pot does not permeate the rooms. Wall plugs without covers...had a electrical spark shoot out behind bed.... Scary!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Bulldoze and rebuild.... New paint does not mean remodeled.
review.locationRemarks: South San Fran....close to airport

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Was looking for last minute hotels by the city for NYE. Ive definitely stayed in worse! Was very pleased with condition of room, service of staff and pricing. I would highly reccommend for budget travel either to the airport or the city!

review.title: value for the money
review.reviewText: lay over night on trip home. pleasant older hotel. friendly staff clean close to airport. quiet

review.negativeRemarks: No wifi or wired connection (though ad says it has); 60s-era lift. Facilities are old and simple

review.reviewText: The window to our room was broken and didn't close all the way, the bathroom was in poor shape. The tub felt like you were going to fall through the floor.

review.title: Convenient to Candlestick Park.
review.reviewText: Would definately stay here again. Convenient to many SF attractions! Had a great stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Ad a spa tub.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel but heating was uncontrollable, either too hot or too cold.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet at night and good breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: fitted bed sheets and more blankets
review.locationRemarks: Easy to locate, near stores on Grand avenue and freeway.

review.title: Convenient location from airport. Free shuttle
Previous Vagabond Inn Lacking in Most Areas
review.reviewText:
While friendly the staff lacks depth in customer service skills. One word answers to most questions; they try hard but are robotic and offer little. The owners are improving the physical but like the one-word answers from staff they are slapping paint over plastic and calling it a "full refurbishing of our hotel". Excuse me, sir, but this is a motel no matter how you try to spin it.
What the building needs and they are not doing is replacing the cheap 1/16" glass panes with double-paned ones to filter the horrendous highway roar and non-stop Caterpillar heavy machinery and semi trucks exiting and entering the freeway nonstop from 5 a.m. to 11 p.m. every day.
Large desk with an uncomfortable chair was a positive but the Internet wifi access was quite slow and unsafe (Hackers present and active on their network, beware!). Local drug users and prostitutes seem to frequent this location so watch your belongings in parking lot and in your room!
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff, some green grass with inner courtyard, access to Silicon Valley and San Francisco. Caltrain is on opposite side of 101
review.negativeRemarks: Sound-proof windows, improve flooring, improve sinks and water pressure in shower... too sparse, too cheap at every level. It needs a deep overhaul
review.locationRemarks: On the highway! South San Francisco offers little; a Denny's, Ihop, Costco, nearby. Avoid McDonald's! Weather is foggy and cold (jacket a must)

review.title: Staff
review.reviewText: Staff did not inform me while checking in where breakfast was in the morning. Other than that they were very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were very comfortable, and cozy.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping close by, and not too far from the Wharf and that area.

review.title: Ok hotel good location.
review.reviewText: My experience was so so... The room was small compared to the online site. The only thing I liked about the hotel was the location.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Located with all other major hotels. Pet friendly. Good for a short stay but not very comfortable. Odd smell but the staff try to keep it clean.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Pretty basic hotel. Offers free shuttle service to the airport every half hour. You can leave your car parked at the hotel for $10 per day. Small boxes of cereal, watered down juices, and pre packaged pastries for breakfast.

review.title: sucks
review.reviewText: Bathroom door so worped it wouldn't close. Motion sensor lights in bathroom would go on and off all night when there was no one moving in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: left early because of the condition of the hotel so could not enjoy any location or activity

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText: When we checked in, I wanted to leave immediately. The common areas smelt like urine - not sure if it was due to pets staying there or what. The room wasn't much better, smelling musty and damp. They are apparently under new management and have been refurbishing... I'd hate to know what it was like beforehand. I thought it looked nothing like the photo's on the website. In the end we stayed as long as we had booked for, five nights, and just made sure we didn't spend much time there. The elevator was so dodgy we avoided using it except for taking our luggage up and down. I was also not pleased with how early housekeeping tried to get into the room. Over the course of our stay they came before 10am on more than one occasion and on our last day when they should have waited for us to check out so that they could do a thorough clean, they tried to come in at 8.30am! I had to go down to reception more than once to ask for enough towels/handtowels/facecloths for the two people booked in the room as they usually only provided enough for one person. Not acceptable in my view. We only stayed here due to the price and the free parking which we couldn't seem to get closer to the city possibly due to our trip clashing with the America's Cup races.
Room waa small but very comfortable and very clean.

review.title: cheap place to stay and close to the airport.
review.reviewText:
It's a hotel for those on a tight budget. Not much to talk about altho' the staff are really helpful and nice. The room is clean and tidy however, needs renovation, bathroom wall is falling apart, and toilet is flushing whenever the other room occupant flushed theirs. It's a clean place to stay if you only want a place to sleep. One thing also is the smell of the room - kinda musty - and smelt like someone smoked in it recently! For a non-smoking room - it does smelt like
a previous customer must have smoked in it.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff are great! From the desk to the housecleaning staff. Polite and kind.
review.negativeRemarks: renovate the bathroom. First thing a customer check is the bathroom, if it is smelly and dirty or falling apart, NOT good for your reviews.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Good in general. Cheap hotel with decent facilities, close to the airport. I liked the staff, very friendly and solicitous. I did not have time to have breakfast, so no information in that respect.

review.title: Convenient Place with Good Rates
review.reviewText: Ok place to stay if you are looking for a good price and not looking too much more than a clean spacious place to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Some Items in Room could have been in better repair, particularly drain in shower

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText:
Very adequate place if you simply need a place to put your bags and lay your head, but do not expect to impress anyone while hanging out at the lobby bar, (there isn't one).
The staff was awesome! They did everything they possibly could to make my stay as pleasant as possible.
The rooms are adequate - clean, hot water, clean towels with soap and shampoo, etc. Once again, you get what you pay for. One the first stay (1 night at the beginning of the trip) the room I was given had a small issue with the window in which it could not close all the way - the heater was turned on and amply compensated. Also the trim work in the room seemed less than I do for my own home. Not an issue, but just something I noticed - the little details.
Breakfast was basic, but pleasant that they offer it, (packaged cereal and pastries).
Honestly, if you keep in mind that this is probably the lowest cost hotel near the airport and you plan to spend most of your time out and about this may be the option!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff!!! Everyone smiled, was pleasant, answered questions politely, and accommodated my every request. Housekeeping included!
review.negativeRemarks: I don't often stay in this level of hotel, so honestly, I'm going to say check the basics like the window I mentioned, and the trim work.
review.locationRemarks: Near airport for quick shuttle to and from, as well San Fran is a short cab ride away!

review.title: Close to the Airport
review.reviewText: Other than it is close to the airport, it was not so nice. The elevator is extremely outdated, although it worked perfectly fine. The major problem is that you can hear everything that is going on next door. At one point it felt as though someone had opened our door; but it was just our neighbor coming in to his room. The room is very basic, and more or less clean.

review.title: Not so bad, it is near to San Francisco Airport...
review.reviewText: there is a strong smell of bleach in the room, Second the heather is not working in the room. Also the room is old, so I wouldn't recommend strongly this hotel to any of my friends....
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms must be redecorated
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Average place to check in. Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Not a bad place if you just need a room to sleep in. I stayed for a couple of nights and it just fairly met what I needed. The place is an old Motel 6 and you can immediately tell as soon as you walked in. The only thing that I like about it is it's proximity to the airport--less than 3 miles away. The building has a side door that leads to the parking lot and you are supposed to use your room key to get in but it seems like its been broken for a while. The bottom line is, the door remains unlocked--not a good thing when you talk about security. .
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the side door locking device. Also, additional pillows would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Next to the freeway.

review.title: Nice, close to candlestick park!
review.reviewText: We didn't spend to much time in the room but it wasn't expensive. If your looking for luxury its not the place to go but it WS comfortable, friendly and ok if your not planning on spenind to much time indoors

review.title: South San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was older but renovated and reasonably clean, cheap price. Friendly staff. 15min walk to the BART, rental cars across the road. Will stay here again on the next trip.

review.title: South SF Hotel Fo cus
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price. The rooms are nicer than the outside apperance and area.

review.title: Fucus hotel
review.reviewText: Stay here only if you lose your sleeping bag and s ow is pouring into your tent. Rundown. Don't bother to eat the breakfast.

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText:
Staff helpful regarding extra night's stay and advice on buses, shopping, flight check and shuttle to airport.
we enjoyed our trips around San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Price was a factor and close proximity to airport
review.negativeRemarks: A coin operated laundry would be beneficial
review.locationRemarks: Ths bus outside Holiday Inn was great as it was a cheap ride to downtown San Francisco, the Big Bus tour was a brilliant way to see the sights

review.title: Hotel improvements need it!
review.reviewText: Hotel elevator was a disaster. We stayed on the second floor and it will took time to door to close and take us to the first floor.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator
review.locationRemarks: Nice to have IHOP really close by.

review.title: Close to downtown by car
review.reviewText:
Very old facility. However, the management is trying desperately to make it functional.
Ok.
Not for those with family & kids.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast

review.title: Very courteous staff.
review.reviewText: Focus Hotel has free shuttle to and from the SFO Airport that was very reliable and prompt. My only complain was that the towels did not have very pleasant appearance and smell they have to improve the way they laundry them.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to the SFO Airport and is in a very safe and quiet location.
review.negativeRemarks: The hallways are tiled with the grouting very far apart that it causes a loud noise when the staff goes up and down with their service carts.
review.locationRemarks: Close to a an Asian buffet restaurant and a conference center.

review.title: To expensive
review.reviewText: Outside of the Hotel was nice but inside it looked like a rally cheep one.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs a little TLC
review.locationRemarks: By the airport

review.title: Good for an early flight
review.reviewText: We booked this motel through Expedia. It was quick and easy. We had an early flight the next morning, so the location was perfect. The motel would need some TLC but it was OK for us. It's basic but rather clean and it has everything you need for a couple of hours of sleep before an early flight. The free shuttle was on time and efficient. We have no complain, we knew what to expect : An OK affordable motel, close to the airport, with a free shuttle. That's what we wanted and that's what we got!
review.positiveRemarks: it's close from the airport (10 min.) and they have a free shuttle.

review.title: Surprise
review.reviewText: Frankly, we did not expect much at the price. Not a pleasant outdoor area, very industrial - but so very convenient to the airport, which was the point. I was concerned about cleanliness. Well, the room was clean, w/new carpet and bathroom flooring. The bed was clean and comfortable. We had an unexpectedly pleasant stay. I do recommend. (For some reason, our room phone did not work so I couldn't call the desk to ask for a few amenities), however, all worked out well and we would glady use it again if we need to be at the airport in the early morn. Worth it to miss the bridge traffic.

review.title: Not luxurious but it is a nice hotel. :)
review.reviewText: Clean room, cable tv, comfortable beds. A.C on point and customer service are really nice. 2min the most to check in and get out key. :) Denny's and IHOP right around the corner. Privacy is on point as well. Worth the $ rate

review.title: Just so so place.
review.reviewText: We stay here because of a tight budget, this is a cheap place we have chosen. However, the hotel was worse than we would expected, the room was equipped with very little facilities, and the sink have a very bad smell. The hotel was besides the main road, and there's a lot of noise from the street. In mid night, I heard people talking and laughing loudly in the hallway several times, I am not sure whether it's from the hotel staff or other tenants, but I do feel that this is not a very safe place to stay. I would not stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Poor to awful
review.reviewText: I should have listened to the majority of the comments but I thought o.k. there are a few who said not bad so we went ahead. Listen to me if its comments are terrible than believe me it's bad. Sorry but I am a smoker and booked a smoking room, get there and there are none available I complained and they said I could get a refund and leave but where could we go at midnight and get up for a early flight so we stay. Get to the room and it smells like urine the bathroom had paint chipping and peeling right of the wall, I could go on but to sum it up stay clear of this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and build a new one.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing it was a quick flight stop over better to stay at airport.

review.title: Good for SF airport stay
review.reviewText: Convenient hotel and clean room, although a bit dated and spartan. I booked a 4 am wake up call and shuttle to airport. Staff didn't provide the promised wake-up call, which could have been disastrous, but we happened to wake and made our shuttle ride which was only 5 minutes to the SF airport. A Denny's was a 5 minute walk away, not much else around.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience to SF airport for an early flight
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade the elevator, provide a couple of easy chairs in the room.
review.locationRemarks: near airport, nothing else nearby

review.title: Fine
review.reviewText: This hotel was a fine place to stay for an overnight before catching an early flight.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny sink and bath facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport.

review.title: ok for a sleepover with short notice.

review.negativeRemarks: bathrooms are a little deteriorated, could use more variety in breakfast.

review.title: good place for tour all day and only for sleep

review.locationRemarks: very near SFO

review.title: Hotel Focus
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were helpful. The hotel is not in a very good area of town. The elevator opens through an actual door and is a bit creepy. I took the stairs after that which is also a safety concern, being that the outside side door to the hotel was unlocked and I'm a female. But I managed. It has vending machines but no other source of food (restaurant, cafe, etc.) other than that and the continental breakfast. That was provided in a very small room which was difficult to maneauver around in with other guests in the room. When I got to my room there was no remote for the television. They gave me one when I asked for it at the front desk. When I took a shower the drain was very slow and by the time I was done taking a shower the bathtub was filled with water up to the level that I would almost fill it if I were taking a bath.
review.positiveRemarks: There were tables to sit on outside in between the two sides of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator, tv remote, quicker draining showers, food.
review.locationRemarks: Don't walk after dark.

review.title: Ok stay. A bit pricey for the hotel condition.
review.reviewText: The elevator looks like a closet. Better off using the stairs. The back entrance has a busted lock and remains constantly open 24 hours. More like a truckers pit stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport and South San Francisco downtown area (nothing to write home about).

review.title: It was close to candle stick park that was good.
review.reviewText: The hotel stay was ok. The workers did not speak English when I asked for towels. The breakfast could of been better no juice milk not even water. There was no customer services in the breakfast area.
review.negativeRemarks: Window safety no screens on windows. The air condition was not working, the telephone was not working. They did not have a coffee pot in the room.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good close to food stops and gas stations. A few minutes away from candle stick park which was good.

review.title: Not bad for a last minute place to stay.
review.reviewText: hotel staff where friendly, specially the cleaning crew. we had to leave a day early from our trip due to a emergency and unfortunately we could not get a refund for the day we were not there. our room was nice, bath room could use better modelling. the hotel is close to the marina and across street from a ihop so that's convenient. .. it was frustrating not knowing how to work the elevator, wish they would change that system or the counter girl could had warn us.
review.positiveRemarks: i like most the free fast internet. the hotel is close to allot of things and only 30 min away from the marina.
review.negativeRemarks: the craftsmanship of the room. the shower nob was being hold together by old glue . it was really frustrating not knowing how to work the elevator.
review.locationRemarks: i hop is across the street. also some gas stations. this hotel is at a really good locatoin

review.title: So-So

review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport and some good restaurants nearby on Grand Ave.

review.title: Just OK

There was cable TV with some channels and a table. Beds were comfy.

review.title: Okay hotel if absolutely nothing else is available

Window was off the track and wouldn't open. No dresser. Carpet, paint and bedding extremely worn and out dated. Not a place I would recommend to family or friends.

The television was small, very limited channels and you really had to press hard on the buttons on the remote to change channels.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the Giants stadium.

review.title: bad in every way possible

From the site to the lobby to the elevator this hotel needs a serious redo. I have stayed in better places for one half the cost. Noise from the road, airport, corridor made our night sleepless.

The staff was courteous though the maids and maintenance people seem not to understand what "do not disturb" means. We were scheduled to spend another night there but opted out and the staff accommodated this with no question.

The breakfast was too a disappointment with limited offering and powdered whitener for the coffee. For the price, a little cream would be expected.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the cost, until i got there.

review.title: Disappointment
review.reviewText: Room was out of date, no towels (had to ask for them) and the cleaniness was in question.

review.title: Clean, cheap hotel. Very close to Fwy.
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located next to the freeway and was very close to most of our destinations. It looks like a rundown hotel but once inside it is clean and the staff is helpful and courteous. There is only one small elevator but it was never a problem. Our room was small but it had a basic TV with basic cable, a table, chair, coffee maker, AC with a fan in it, double beds and small toilet/bathroom. The one blanket on the beds felt like a sponge and the bed was what we shall call firm. The only thing we cared about was cleanliness since we knew we were getting a cheap hotel and have been "traumatized" by previous cheap places. The reviews were right, CLEAN it was. Clean carpet and bathroom (minimal amenities) The bed had crisp white linens and every inch of that room was approved clean by my girlfriend. We were able to easily connect to their free WiFi and they had an ice maker we used downstairs. Apparently they will be adding a breakfast area but we just stayed for one night and left early to sightsee so no comment on that. Great for a BASIC rest your head on a clean fluffy pillow kind of place.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of blankets, amenities, overall appearance.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway, Candlestick Park and Downtown SF.

review.title: Close to Airport

review.title: Hotel was old
review.reviewText: beds were not comfortable.Hotel had a blackout for hours had to lea and check in at another hotel w
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need to be updated. one of the beds was in a corner

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
We were only at our hotel to sleep. The location of the hotel was nice and close to the airport. We took the hotel shuttle free to the international airport where we rode the BART to downtown San Francisco for exploring. The hotel also has free parking for a rental vehicle. A rental vehicle is recommended if you plan to do any sight seeing out side of North San Francisco. Take the stairs to your room; elevator is scarey!

I would only recommend this hotel if you are a tourist looking for a cheap hotel with a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor condition
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Pretty good budget hotel
review.reviewText:
I stayed here with the wife and our 2 year old. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. That was probably the best feature of the hotel.
The elevator, while functional, was the old kind with the sliding door but it served its purpose. The room size was pretty much what you would expect. In the room though was this really large desk positioned right at the foot of the bed leaving only about 2 ft of walking space between the desk and bed. It seemed very tight. We actually slid the desk to the corner to open up the room a bit.

The "TV" was more of a computer monitor that was only about 21" that sat on the desk. They only have a few stations that you can watch. I believe HBO was one of them.

There was no lock on the bathroom door. This can be a problem if you have small children as mine kept wanting to open and close the door.

The location was really close to the airport and within walking distance of a Denny's which came in really handy as their "breakfast" was pretty minimal. They did have 1 waffle machine and coffee. They also had pastries but they usually were gone fast and they didn't replace them. I think they also had oatmeal packets and hot water for tea.

Another thing I noticed that there was only like 1 electrical outlet in the whole room. They put an adapter in it to give you a total of six plugs. Between the tv, phone, coffee maker, etc. the amount of available outlets was insufficient.
review.negativeRemarks: More electrical outlets
review.locationRemarks: Airport, Denny's, and IHop very close by.

review.title: RUN DOWN
review.reviewText: I RESERVED A TWO BED NON SMOKING BUT ENDED UP WITH A ONE BED NO SMOKING. WHEN I ASKED WHERE THE TWO BED ONE WAS I WAS TOLD THERE WERE ONLY SMOKING ROOMS AVAILABLE.

review.title: Recommend If Bed Change, Clean Towels Not Expected
review.reviewText:
we knew what to expect since we had selected a hotel at a lower price range. The hotel room was clean and comfortable for the price range we had selected. On the second day of our stay, maid service knocked on our door at 9:00 a.m., as we were not ready. We answered the door and said no, later. When we arrived back at room that night, found our room not done. Bed not made, no clean towels, etc. Understandable can happen with language barrier. Front desk was very apologetic, offered clean towels, coffee packs,etc.
The following morning at approximately same time, maid service knocked. We had been awakened by knock so our response was later! We arrived late again that night back at our room to find once more our room was not done. Does the hotel not record their housekeeping done and compare it with rooms checked in?
We've never stayed in a hotel where we needed to ensure our room would be done daily!
With that experience, noticing water seeping from under click lock tiles in bathroom when we first checked to our room, and the very poor quality elevator available for guest use (sometimes not working) added up to a disapppointing stay !
review.positiveRemarks: Location -handy to airport, easy access,has potential to be value for your money
review.negativeRemarks: lack of communication ? to ensure housekeeping completed,
review.locationRemarks: handy to airport, easy access off of I 101

review.title: Accommodations
review.reviewText:
I think the cleanliness was very good. The bed was the most comfortable I ever slept in!
They only had ice and microwave, snacks on 1st floor, I wish they were on every floor. I wish they had a refrigerator in the room. I hated the elevator. It was very old and tiny. Overall, it was ok, I feel it is a little overpriced for the quality. The tv had like 6 channels
review.positiveRemarks: The bed. Most comfortable I have ever had
review.negativeRemarks: Accommodations, placement of vending machines, elevator.

review.title: Standard Hotel Room, clean!
review.reviewText: It was a standard hotel room with typical looks. Nothing fancy, but at this price, I didn't expect anything. staff was nice, bed was SUPER comfy (NO BED BUGS!), LOTS of pillows, room was VERY clean. It's obvious they're upgrading, doing a good job. There's a pretty little picnic area out back with some nice tables and flowers and trees. It was nice for the night.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport, not a bad drive in to North Frisco.

review.title: Old Run Down Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff seemed pretty good and I think room service did all they could given the condition of facility. There is only so much you can do with ancient carpet. Carpet seemed very old and kind of smelly. The hotel did not seem to be very well insulated, so was kind of loud. On the surface it seemed like a pretty seedy place. It had a pretty respectable clientele and employees. It almost seemed inconsistent with the building.
review.negativeRemarks: New Carpet
review.locationRemarks: Close by Airport business that I need to call on in my line of work.

review.title: Close to airport

review.title: A hotel good close to airport and herze
review.reviewText: The hotel has shuttle to the airport and close to Herze car rental company. It is a good choice for self travling. Breakfast is nice, with waffle maker, coffee, bread and fruit.
review.positiveRemarks: The room is clean, have a ute back yard for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The printing service.
review.locationRemarks: Rent car, costco.

review.title: They should pay YOU to stay here!
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel for 2 nights, but ended up spending the first night with my friend in the hospital. If sleeping on a cot in a hospital is preferable to staying at your hotel, you've got serious problems. When you arrive at a hotel and there are more "guests" hanging out in the lobby than people checking in, run. The hotel is run down, but it's clean. The staff is apathetic at best. The elevator is creepy and reminiscent of a horror movie. Given the welcome I'd received, I expected it to reek of urine, but it freshly scrubbed and borderline bleachy. The room itself was in need of renovation, but was exactly what I expected based on pictures and reviews I'd read. The bed was not comfortable, but I was only going to be there for approximately 12 hours, so I wasn't bothered. There were cigarette burns on the tub and the toilet was running when I arrived. Screaming children (there were many), I can forgive; screaming adults, are another story. The couple in the room next to me were in an all-out Jerry Springer-like shouting match. I imagined chairs being tipped over, shoes being thrown. Where was Steve to stop this insanity?? The argument went on in and out of the room for at least 40 minutes before management intervened. As the initial argument turned into one with the manager, I decided that this was my cue to leave, booked another hotel, then made a run for it. If you're looking for character studies for a novel or gritty television drama, this is the place for you.
review.positiveRemarks: It was run down, but clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel, hire security guards, and take customer service classes.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport, but no restaurants nearby except for Denny's.

review.title: So...so
review.reviewText: They left my window open. Didn't even know about it until a crackhead female came banging on it. I was so scared given I've only read these types of things in the news given I'm new to America. Awful service. The sheets were dirty but again the price was competitive.

review.title: Great hotel if you like to stress
review.reviewText: Very disappointed in this hotel! Had requested to expedia agent that i would check-in on Sat. at 4am and for 2 days, he told me it would end on Mon. at noon. Arrived at 6am and was told could not check-in until 3pm =/ When i did check-in at 3:30pm, turned out there wasn't a single bed room like I had reserved. Got a 2 bed room at no extra charge but still. The room had a flat-screen tv with a dvd player (but didnt notify us it did not work). Found out after we had inserted a redbox dvd and couldnt it eject. Still there right now most likely. They couldn't get anyone to remove it. *sigh* just move along.....
review.negativeRemarks: Malfunctioning dvd player, Poor customer service, little coordination with expedia,
review.locationRemarks: Thats ok i guess...

review.title: Old but ok...
review.reviewText: The hotel is old and parking was not adequate - however, the staff went out of their way to be sure I had a safe place to park. The rooms are adequate - not fancy, but clean and the bed was comfortable. I wish they had warmer blankets (I didn't ask for more, was just cool during the night). Overall, for an inexpensive place to stay overnight while in San Francisco it was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Lack of parking
review.locationRemarks: great. easy to get to.

review.title: Cheap hotel, that's about it.
review.reviewText: It was a cheap hotel that I needed for one night. I checked on late, the lobby was closed, so you check in through a window. Elevator was hard to find, towels had stains on them. But all else was ok.

review.title: Avoid it!
review.reviewText:
I visited San Francisco on business and simply needed a room with a bed and not much else. Never before have I had to change hotels because of the quality, but this is exactly what happened at the Vagabond Hotel. The room was old looking. The sheets, while clean, were clearly worn and in need of replacement. The elevator looked like it was built in the 70's and was so poorly maintained that I was afraid to enter it.

I just needed some sleep, but there were people yelling in the hallways most of the night (last one was around 4AM). Cigarette smoke wafted under the poorly sealed door from people smoking in the hallway. The room had only one outlet, and it was overloaded with lamps, televisions, and everything else in the room, so I couldnt even charge my laptop. I thought maybe they would offer a decent breakfast (they advertise a continental breakfast), but I found only hot water, some oatmeal packets and apples barely bigger than golf balls.

The staff clearly didn't care about an unhappy guest and did not appear surprised I asked for a refund This was absolutely the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The quality of guests, combined with its size makes for a very bad combo. Expedia was very helpful in getting me an alternate booking down the street in the same price range, and securing a refund from this place. I'd recommend keep very clear of this hotel.

review.title: Convenient location!

if you on the budget - this is it! conveniently located - close to SFO and major HWYs.

review.title: Best deal in town with easy access to Hwy 101
review.reviewText:
Very clean room, confortable bed, well maintained bathroom, clean carpet which look nearly new, high speed WI-FI was great and helpful staff. Stayed 5 nights while supervising a small construction project. For the price - it was the best deal in town with easy freeway access to Hwy 101 going both north and south.

The two main draw backs were: parking located quite far from the room and the elevator door in the lobby was hard to open and it opened into a narrow hallway. The room could have used a few more coat hangers.

review.title: worse hotel ever
review.reviewText: I have never experienced such horrid condition. First thekeycards didn't work so the front desk had to open door, you couldn't leave room. Window would not close room was freezing. Changed rooms at 11pm too cold to sleep. The phones didn't work had to call front desk from cell. Next room had no chair. I only chose this hotel because other hotels were full I would have been better off sleeping in car.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was bad. Morning clerk was scary

review.title: good for drunks.
review.reviewText: The dash board on the bed fell.tv could not see channels just fizzy.

review.title: Ok for price, but far from main part of town
review.reviewText:
Room and hotel were ok, since I wasn't planning on spending much time there anyway -- pretty much a place to sleep and shower, then off I went. I'd never really been to the area, so hadn't realized it was a 20 minute (40 in traffic) drive to the attractive, touristy area of town, but hey, you get what you pay for. Room was kinda small, restroom even smaller. There were only about 2 wall outlets in the entire room, and that was because I had to disconnect an alarm clock from behind a dresser to have more than one outlet I could use. The toilet pipes would whine when you flushed, and even some times on its own throughout the night, so had to make sure the restroom door was closed since I'm a light sleeper.

Despite all this, it wasn't all that terrible (again, didn't plan spending much time there anyway), but next time I think I'll shell out the extra $20 a night and stay closer to the fun stuff.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall ok for what I needed it (place to crash after long day exploring San Fran).
review.negativeRemarks: Only 2 usable wall outlets in entire room. Toilet pipes would whine. Overall location not attractive
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport (if you fly in), some places to eat here and there, inexpensive.

review.title: Basic, comfortable, good value
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable basic room, with a very comfortable bed. Aircon was good. Could be a little noisy in the evenings, and breakfast was basic, but ultimately good value for money.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the other guests were a bit noisy
review.locationRemarks: About 1.2 miles walk from San Bruno BART station (convenient for SFO airport) and 0.8 miles from the Caltrain station. Close to some restaurants.

review.title: Not comfortable to stay by oneself
review.reviewText: I travel by myself and just needed an inexpensive room. The area where this is located did not have me feeling safe and secure since I was staying by myself.

review.title: eh... it was ok
review.reviewText:
The hotel wasn't anything special. We got it for a late night crash pad close to the airport since i had an early flight back to Houston. The front desklady was nice, even though it was late. Elevator is kinda weird/scary. Rooms are small, but we were only there for 4 hours, so I cant complain.

Everything was so so.. i would have been more up tight had i not been exhausted.
review.negativeRemarks: No outlets near the bed, messed up tv, old carpet, weird shower.

review.title: Would look elsewhere for another motel.
review.reviewText: The photos online are deceiving. The front of the buildings aesthetics were good, hence the reason we went ahead and chose to book. But once arriving to our destination and arriving in our room, you could tell that this motel is in much need of repair. The elevator had to have been dated way back. I didn't even know it was an elevator. The cleanliness of the room was good, but repairs we very much needed. The clerk at the counter was quite nice. Over all when we come back to this vicinity, we are hoping to book with another motel in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: The flooring/carpeting was in need of repair
review.locationRemarks: The location was fine and easy access to the freeway

review.title: Would not reccommend
review.reviewText: Towels were not replaced, just removed. We had to ask for clean towels and then had to go get them from the lobby. There was no toilet paper holder or plug for the bathtub. The blanket on the bed was no thicker then the sheets but at least the weather was warm.
review.negativeRemarks: The maid service
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find from airport, easy to access freeways

review.title: inexpensive but clean
review.reviewText: the property is old and well used. however, the cleanliness and accomodating staff made the stay pleasurable for me.
review.positiveRemarks: close to freeway, bus and caltraini
review.negativeRemarks: i had to make my own coffee
review.locationRemarks: located on motel row near s. san fran town

review.title: Stay only as a last resort
review.reviewText: This is as spartan as it gets. Minimum furniture, tiny bathroom area, lumpy bed and a 12" 15 year old TV. If this is what you are looking for, this is your place. Otherwise, stay away.

review.title: Cheap hotel acceptable pricing and service
review.reviewText:
Heater was working good but aluminum windows transmit a lot of noise from near-by freeway,
bathroom faucet had loose finish trim.
review.negativeRemarks: Not everything is in good working condition.
review.locationRemarks: Location is kind of noisy

review.title: Great hotel experience!
review.reviewText: We loved staying here!!!! The staff was very helpful. Your stay comes with breakfast which we thought that was awesome. The room was huge very clean! Overall we enjoyed our 3 night stay there.
review.locationRemarks: South san francisco

review.title: Worst experience ever
review.reviewText: Mold in bathrooms, tv didn't work, heater didn't work, blankets too thin, beds too hard, walls WAY to thin - heard every step and whisper our neighbors made - will not be coming back, despite the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: everything with the rooms
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: Vagabon
review.reviewText: Older motel needs renovation and fixed up. Not to bad for a quick nights stay by the airport
review.negativeRemarks: size of room cleanness
review.locationRemarks: Needs renovation

review.title: Disappointed.
review.reviewText: Bad experience in this motel. Never come again. No bath towels ready for use until 9 pm after contacted with staff several times. Coffee maker didn't work and none came to fix or replace even asking staffs for it.

review.title: Terrible smell, and loud hallways..
review.reviewText: The noise from the halls was unbearably loud that I checked out before my scheduled day to move to a separate hotel. The room at first glance appears to be clean but there was a very strong smell that was very unpleasant.. Overall I would never stay at this hotel ever again.
review.negativeRemarks: smell, noise
review.locationRemarks: No shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Don't stay at this hotel
review.reviewText: Room was dirty, mold in the bathroom and the elevator is out of a 60s horror film.

review.title: better than its name
review.reviewText: This is no-nonsense accommodation, well suited to the quick in-and-out needs of an airport hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: a bit hard to find
review.locationRemarks: very near SFO

review.title: Convenient to SFO. I wasn't mugged.
review.reviewText:
Just fine if you're flying out of SFO in the morning. Stay somewhere else, if you're looking for a comfortable night away from home.

Be prepared to drive a bit for dinner. A BJ's microbrew/sports bar/rtestaurant is within 5 miles of the motel.
review.negativeRemarks: Grubby and cheap, reminded me of my freshman college dorm.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO.

review.title: A little disappointed!
review.reviewText:
You get what you pay for!
Bathroom sink was in the hallway entrance. Bathroom door jammed against the floor and was difficult to close. Only 2 sets of towels were provided for 3 guests. No ice machine. No hair dryer. No continental breakfast. This hotel is used by many guests that are scheduled for early flights from SFO. Even though the facility is older, better upkeep and upgrades would make it more attractive.

review.title: airport hotel
review.reviewText: no addmenties like hairdyer, ref. bed very uncomfortable. close to airport was the only plus
review.negativeRemarks: bed
review.locationRemarks: close to airport

review.title: No complaints, great for the price!
review.reviewText: We had no issues with this hotel, for the price I feel like it was right. Our room was actually huge, we had plenty of room. The bathroom area was small, just a little sink outside of the bathroom with the shower and toilet, so no real counter space but that wasn't a big deal. We were able to drive 3 minutes to the BART station, park there, and take that transit everywhere. We were also able to drive directly to downtown in about 15 minutes. It worked for us for the price and was in a decent area, not scary at all. I have no complaints!

review.title: Good for students
review.reviewText: It was a place to sleep on short notice without any frills. I recommend this for students and young people. Kinda like a pension in Europe.
review.negativeRemarks: the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: easy to find near the airport

review.title: not worth it!
review.reviewText: Cheap but disappointing. Rooms are small and unkempt. No ice buckets, had to get a trash bag from the front desk for ice. Staff was neither friendly nor helpful.

review.title: Low cost, not luxury
review.reviewText: It's a hotel for saving money, not luxury. Staff was friendly
review.negativeRemarks: no luxuries
review.locationRemarks: reasonable

review.title: Hotel is close to the Airport
review.reviewText: This hotel has very old blankets ...the blankets were so rough and thin it felt like a rough sponge :(

review.title: Stay Away from this place
review.reviewText:
Old, not very clean, elevator need to be condemn, the place very noisy people shouting in the
corridors and so were kids.
I will never stay there again
review.locationRemarks: OK, close enough to the airport

review.title: Good hotel for SFO
review.reviewText: Used hotel as had to be at SFO at 5am and didn't want to drive 2 hours. Room was clean and smelled fresh. The beds were very good and looked like they had just been replaced. The continental breakfast met the bare minimum but was adequate. Would definitely stay here again for early or late flights.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to SFO easy access to 101

review.title: Good Bargain
review.reviewText: Listen, if you are looking for a place to just sleep at a very reasonable price then this is a good bargain. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. IHop and Chinese restaurant is few blocks a away. You can take a short ride to airport not too far from the hotel by bus $2.00 or $11 by taxi.
review.negativeRemarks: old bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport and IHOP and Chinese buffet restaurant

review.title: good comfort at affordable price
review.reviewText:
Stay was good.
Room cleanliness has to improve a bit.
Doors were not closing properly. Particularly the rest rooms.

review.title: It was awful
review.reviewText: The elevator didnt work ,stairs some one was sleeping their smell of urine awful,i want my noney back.
review.negativeRemarks: stunk
review.locationRemarks: san fransico

review.title: Not worth the price
review.reviewText: Like an old...tired.... Motel 6. Only positive thing was its location near the SF airport. There "free" breakfast was a joke....didn't even have tea.
review.locationRemarks: Only good thing...near the airport where we needed to go early the next morning

review.title: Not a bargain
review.reviewText: We were a couple. There was only one chair, one wash cloth, and no bath mat, shower cap or bath soap. The TV remote didn't work. When we went down to breakfast they were out of coffee and there was no place to sit and drink it. They did have good rolls which we took back to the room where we made our own coffee and ate them. The charges were enough that we expected the usual things.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: It wasn't set up for a couple
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport

photos.caption: When I first saw the remote control I cleaned it before I touched it. I took pictures later and was still able to find white milky substances on the controller. It was originally much worse. So bad that I did not want to touch it.
Food stain on TV. The brown stain was a smear but there was a glob of something thick and sticky at the top right of the stain.
One of the hairs in the bathroom. I could only upload six pictures so I added only one of the hairs.

review.title: Disgusting
review.reviewText:
As I showed up all seemed normal but as I made my way to my room I began to notice the uncleanliness of the hotel. By the way, I was staying in their most expensive room. I got in my room and began to unpack and try to get comfortable. Their beds are extremely stiff and uncomfortable. The remote control was sticky and had a white milky substance on the buttons and side of the remote. (disgusting) I walked the rest of the room and found cobwebs in the corner above the sink, there was food stains on top of the TV, on the desk, and the phone was dirty and dusty and black hairs were in the bathroom. Definitely not mine! I would stay as far away from this hotel as you can. I wanted to speak with the manager and was given a phone number, she could not provide me with an email address. No one ever answered that phone number provided and no one returned my call when I left a message. There is a Comfort Inn just down the street with the same rates essentially but 10 times the room quality.I went there, you should too!

BTW The breakfast that they provide is an apple or a packet of oatmeal with no where to eat it but in your car or back in your room.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and service.
review.locationRemarks: Not bad. Close to the Airport, but there are plenty of other hotels in this area that are much better quality.

review.title: Very basic amenities, but very clean.
review.reviewText: Very clean room and toilet. There was no fridge and hairdryer, and tv channel signal was spotty at times, but if you come here just to crash for the night, then it is acceptable. They also have free breakfast cereal and wi-fi, so overall it's ok.

review.title: Basic but adequate for a one night stay
review.reviewText:
I did not expect much and was neither surprised nor disappointed. The room was basic but adequate to get a good night's sleep during a short stay. There was an unpleasant hint of cigarrette smoke when I first got to the room.

The price was good for the area.

review.title: Awful ........
review.reviewText: There are no words to describe how bad this place was. I was sorely tempted to sleep in my car, but there were vagrants in the parking lot so I wasn't safe there either. To say it was dirty in an understatement. Two out of the three lamps in the room didn't work. The floor in the shower/tub was mushy, like maybe there is dry rot underneath. The window had zero chalking so you could see and feel the outside weather. The only thing good about this place was the young lady working the check-in counter. When our TV didn't work and I was not about to get on the floor and see what the problem might be, she came right over with a smile on her face and fixed it.

review.title: Affordable, Clean
review.reviewText: Although drapes could be in better condition and the place reminded me of homes from the 50s & 60s, my room was clean, the breakfast was adequate and the yard was lovely for visiting with my friend. Although outdated, the price was what I could afford, the staff was polite, thus for an inexpensive one-night stay, it was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room even though outdated, lovely yard with chairs and tables ... polite staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator ... wondered if it would make it, but it did.
review.locationRemarks: VERY close to SFO, which was primary reason for being there.

review.title: Last time I will rely on Expedia for a hotel -
review.reviewText: a very expensive hotel - with no amenities - the continental breakfast was a disgrace. rooms very baron.
review.negativeRemarks: evrything I have just said
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Great pricing, creepy vibe
review.reviewText: Great price, room was kept clean. Just had a creepy vibe to it. Other than that good bargain.

review.title: It will do for a low enough price
review.reviewText: This room had nothing to offer, it was clean enough. Needs to be a low price to be worth it.

review.title: Okay if you don't plan to spend much time in room
review.reviewText: I guess I would say the hotel was about what you would expect for the price. The first room they gave me had a broken security latch, a TV that did not work and a running toilet. Because the TV did not work in the first room, they moved me to a second room. The second room was better. The other thing to mention about the hotel is there seemed to be a number of transient residents and I didn't feel comfortable leaving my valuables in the room. None of these issues were too significant for me, however, because I was only there two nights and I did not spend most of my time in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Upkeep is not too good

review.title: Good location, disappointing hotel.
review.reviewText:
Should have known by choosing a Hotel called Vagabond. The good: centrally located to my various destinations (near SFO).

The Bad: Generally dank and not well kept, the shower was at eye level, a rolling cart kept going by down the bumpy tiled floor making a lot of noise at all hours, paper thin walls and a lack of electrical plugs for my various devices. I'll trade up next time.
review.negativeRemarks: noisy
review.locationRemarks: near SFO

review.title: Cheapest option
review.reviewText: The location is not the best. It is noisy and far from city center but if you are with car it easy to reach the downtown. The hotel rooms have new beds and seems like freshly painted walls but the windows, doors, bathroom, airconditioning device are really old. The wifi works only in the lobby area only. It was impossible to connect from floor 3. All in all for this price this hotel is not a bad option for 1-2 nights but for a longer stay I would definitely look for an other one.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall condition of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Noisy, no shopping opportunity near by.

review.title: Unpleasant Hotel Stay.
review.reviewText:
It was a very unpleasant experience..
It will be my first and last stay. It was horrible due to the poor service, dirty towels and very inconvenient way just to check in after 11pm. It was very cold to wait for more than 20 minutes standing outside the hotel due to the slow service of the front desk assigned that evening. He was impolite and showed incompetence in what he does talking on the phone while assisting others to check-in standing in the cold outside of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty towels.
review.locationRemarks: Parking is no maintained with bushes and unpaved area.

review.title: cheap and it shows
review.reviewText:
The primary objective was being close to the airport, in that aspect, win!
The prioce was reasonable, but I have been in similarly priced accommodations that were A LOT nicer.
The carpet is new, as is the paint job. The beds are very old and not very comfortable.
The curtains and window were filthy. Some decor on the walls would be nice.

review.title: Not Happy
review.reviewText:
Worst stay. Noisy guests keep me up all night. Would not stay there again!

The staff was great on check in.

review.title: What's the REAL shuttle story at the SFO Vagabond?
review.reviewText: When we called earlier that day, we were told that there was a shuttle that started at 4AM to SFO. Felt used and abused after we checked in and we were told that there was no shuttle and we would have to take a taxi. Had we known that, we would not have stayed at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Shuttle shuffle....
review.locationRemarks: GREAT if it had a shuttle....

review.title: pretty good place to crash
review.reviewText: pretty good place to crash for the price... just bring an extra towel. an extra star for the fruit in the am (bfast ends exactly at 9) but its just fruit and pretty bad coffee.
review.locationRemarks: ok, near some good stuff

review.title: very bad condition hotel!
review.reviewText:
1,surrounded by 2 highway,everyroom is noisy!
2,The breakfirst is awful,it can't call breakfirst,just bread and coffee,fruit is rotten
3,no wifi signal in most of the rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: noisy location

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: Very dirty feel to the place. The staff recommends that you go to the hotek across the street for a drink or atm machine. They were not very helpful... it seems that there are many more options in terms of hotels around the area. especially ones with a less grimy feel

review.title: stay at own risk
review.reviewText: Every time i left the room and returned my room key card failed to open the door. Management was rude about the issue and failed to even id me when they were asked to fix keycard. Stay at your own risk. I will never come back. Bed was a rock with sheets on it. Lavatory is very low to ground and child in size.
review.negativeRemarks: Room proximity to office. All vending machine's inoperable. No cups provided to room.
